comment: DaVita continues to hire unqualified staff in an effort to save money and keep their clinics staffed. Most of the administrators lack any type of medical training, and management experience. The clinics have a lot of turnover and are constantly short staffed. DaVita pays the lowest wages even to their few experienced team members. The benefits are also lacking, as well as work life balance. Overall I do not recommend this company to anyone.

author: Registered Nurse (RN)
comment: Team work is amazing in acutes. As a new team member I feel totally supported but the nurses that were here before me. Communication can suck sometimes but the team work makes up for it.

cons: ["Difficult at times to work with patients on a time limit"]
author: Tell-Health RN
comment: I learned a lot with Stericycle. The work culture is wonderful and the organization of company works to assist the clients. Unfortunately they were not interested or understood how to grow the business for RN skills so a handful on RNs including myself hadnpositions eliminated.

cons: ["Everything is timed down to the minute."]
author: Post Discharge Services, Cinical RN
comment: I was in a small, specialized group and got laid off. That being said, I would work for them again in a heartbeat. Great place to work, never met a bad manager, super great people. Everyone there lifts you up and is available and wanting to make sure you do your best. They truly believe in a work/life balance and both staff and management will work to assure if there is something special going on in your life that you need time off or a shift change, if at all possible they will make it happen.

author: Registered Nurse, Bachelor's of Science in Nursing
comment: fabulous it was a very family oriented company to work for., the manager was always willing to work with the employee with any issues. training was always top notch

author: Registered Nurse
comment: Fun to work, low pay, work is kind of stressful, but work environment is relaxed. Supervisor cares about staff and encourages employees to voice concerns.

author: Registered Nurse
comment: Great work atmosphere, I‚Äôm in the community mostly. Pay could be better but I won‚Äôt complain lol. They‚Äôre really focused on meeting patients/members where they are. Nurses really have autonomy!

tittle: Rapid response healthcare staffing therefore inconsistent opportunities available. However when opportunities avail themselves this company does is go
author: Emergency Department, Registered Nurse Emergency
comment: I would recommend this company. This company opportunities include rapid responses and short term positions. The company is a responsive employer however can become chaotic during employment for an assignment. This company is constantly tweaking to make the onboarding process more efficient and user-friendly.

author: Staff Nurse
comment: The company is very unorganized. The company lacks communication among each other. Multiple calls from different agents stating contradictory information pertaining to the same subject.

tittle: No job security and you work your butt off.
author: RN Staff Nurse
comment: It was good way back in the day, but no loyalty now. The on-site manager was known to send people home if she didn‚Äôt like them and you could never go to them with issues. Shift assignments went to their pets and you were randomly mandated to take a day off if they brought too many people in.

author: Registered Nurse
comment: It used to be owned and operated by a single owner and at the time I traveled they were the best paying travel company . Then the owner passed away and the company incorporated and now they have it divided up into so many different categories of pay vs benefits that now you pretty much just go with the travel company that can put you in the location you want

author: Registered Nurse
comment: The standard one would expect from any healthcare institution. Culture is congruent with the culture of the city it sits in. Work day is standard. 1234

author: Registered Nurse-TRAVEL
comment: Most assignments were to busy units and when assigned unit was not busy, the travel nurse floated first. Host hospitals were easy to work for, never had any conflict, always had any issues resolved quickly and fairly.

pros: ["my recruiter and the salary was above average."]
author: Registered Nurse
comment: I loved all my temporary travel assignments. Labor and Delivery always had many to choices.

tittle: Rapid response healthcare staffing therefore inconsistent opportunities available. However when opportunities avail themselves this company does is go
author: Emergency Department, Registered Nurse Emergency
comment: I would recommend this company. This company opportunities include rapid responses and short term positions. The company is a responsive employer however can become chaotic during employment for an assignment. This company is constantly tweaking to make the onboarding process more efficient and user-friendly.

author: Staff Nurse
comment: The company is very unorganized. The company lacks communication among each other. Multiple calls from different agents stating contradictory information pertaining to the same subject.

tittle: No job security and you work your butt off.
author: RN Staff Nurse
comment: It was good way back in the day, but no loyalty now. The on-site manager was known to send people home if she didn‚Äôt like them and you could never go to them with issues. Shift assignments went to their pets and you were randomly mandated to take a day off if they brought too many people in.

author: Registered Nurse
comment: It used to be owned and operated by a single owner and at the time I traveled they were the best paying travel company . Then the owner passed away and the company incorporated and now they have it divided up into so many different categories of pay vs benefits that now you pretty much just go with the travel company that can put you in the location you want

author: Registered Nurse
comment: The standard one would expect from any healthcare institution. Culture is congruent with the culture of the city it sits in. Work day is standard. 1234

author: Registered Nurse-TRAVEL
comment: Most assignments were to busy units and when assigned unit was not busy, the travel nurse floated first. Host hospitals were easy to work for, never had any conflict, always had any issues resolved quickly and fairly.

pros: ["my recruiter and the salary was above average."]
author: Registered Nurse
comment: I loved all my temporary travel assignments. Labor and Delivery always had many to choices.

cons: ["Sometimes a long distance to isolated locations."]
tittle: Variable schedules, Allowed to refuse certain assignments,
author: Registered Nurse
comment: Nurses and Professionals Healthcare is a local registry started by an RN about 1990. Over the years moved from a two room office in Paradise, CA to a large office complex in Chico. I have worked with this agency since 1994 and have enjoyed my experiences.  A typical day involved organizing the different locations around the state that I was assigned to work. My furthest location was 390 miles from home. I learned to be flexible with assignment requirements and was able to rely on office staff to manage housing, reimbursement of expenses, and to handle any emergencies.  I rarely saw any of my registry coworkers at distance sites but were always cordial.  The hardest part was learning new charting programs at different sites; up to four in a week. Developing proficiency in any one program was difficult.  I most enjoyed the scenic drives through the heart of California and seeing many new areas I have never seen.

author: RN
comment: Again, I find these survey questions annoying. I do not like working as a registry nurse and I do not recommend it to any one. You shouldn't bait and switch people on this site.

cons: ["not much room for advancement in my department"]
author: RN
comment: I enjoy working as a nurse and working with an interdisciplinary team of healthcare professionals. A typical day at my present employment includes working with parents of infants in preparation for discharge and providing parents with the tools and skills necessary to succeed.

pros: ["Great co-workers, great medical director, great workload"]
cons: ["only con was Less money for working for no benefits."]
tittle: Enjoyable atmosphere to work in; good relationships with coworkers, doctors, and clients
author: Staff RN
comment: I worked in Occupational Medicine/Employee Health. We were responsible for giving and reading all employee TB skin tests as well as other immunizations that were needed for work. Our department was also contracted with some local business to do physical assessments and drug screens on their prospective hires. I enjoyed learning the proper way to do a physical assessment. Finding out everything that is involved in doing a drug screen Correctly was very interesting - and finding out the ways people would try to get around it! I always enjoyed my co-workers. Many of us had known each other and worked together in other areas of the hospital for years. I enjoyed everything about the job, including the boss. I think the hardest part of the job was the pay. They were not of the mindset that your pay should be More than average if you are not receiving benefits. As a result, the pay was lower than a new nurse coming in. But I still loved it - fantastic working environment. Miss it.

cons: ["there is no job security and benefits"]
tittle: good place to work for enrtry level
author: Staff Nurse
comment: It is a staffing and caregiving agency. There is no job security. When your patient dies, you lose your job and would wait for days and months before you are given another assignment.

author: RN Travel Nurse
comment: Flexible hours and excellent pay. Opportunity to meet great people. Travel to New areas and learn more about Healthcare. Great Opportunity for overtime, pet friendly housing included.

author: RN Travel Nurse
comment: They ‚Äúpromised‚Äù Covid pay in the contract but it was not paid. I was a counselor to my recruiter. When I got Covid I was let go from my contract after working 2 extra days almost weekly.

author: Registered Nurse
comment: No smooth process. Multi submission of documents due to system issues. Difficult to complete if you have to speak to a different person each time. Errors made by associates. Low pay on contracts.

author: RN Staff Nurse
comment: I have enjoyed my time there. Management is good and pays attention to your needs. I feel valued as an employee bug wish work life balance was better.

tittle: Horrible people that doesn't care about their staff
author: RN
comment: Worst place to work. They don't care about you and will stiff you of your pay. Wasted my time to go work for them and I was never paid. Horrible experience for me. Put me off travel nursing.

author: RN
comment: I really love working here, I love my recruiter who works hard to get contracts for me that suit my needs. I wish there were more available contracts.

author: RN
comment: I have completed 6 travel assignments with them. My recruiter has been awesome, all other supportive staff has been amazing. No payroll issues, checks have been on time and correct for each assignment.

author: RN
comment: This is the worst agency I‚Äôve ever had a contract with ‚Äî poor communication and zero support. My contract ended in 2020 and I am STILL upset about the whole experience. AVOID!

author: Registered Nurse
comment: Overall good experience on multiple assignments. My recruiter was very responsive and had a good working relationship. Had one bad experience on one assignment and wasn‚Äôt well supported by company.

pros: ["Paychecks on time, no issues, very straightforward."]
tittle: My recruiter was respectful and answered all questions. Worked with them for a year. Paychecks are always on time, had no issues at any of my jobs
author: RN
comment: My recruiter was respectful and answered all questions. Worked with them for a year. Paychecks are always on time, had no issues at any of my jobs. Very responsive you can always reach someone.

cons: ["Lack of recruiter support when issues came up."]
tittle: I can't think if anything that stands out. Benefits are not as plentiful as other companies
author: RN Travel Nurse
comment: Did not feel my recruiter stood up for me when needed and allowed me to be transferred from the original contract area to another area without asking if I wanted to go to the new area. An issue came up while working with this company and I didnt feel as though I had any back up.

tittle: You have to stay on top of recruiter...
author: Registered Nurse
state: Found that had to frequently direct and then redirect recruiter in obtaining placements and answers.  Be careful. They ask you to pay for things up front and say they will will reimburse you sometimes over $300 up front prior to working things and when say no they continue to ask you to pay saying will be reimbursed. Say they cover expenses to get ready for the job Such as drug testing and vaccinations. Was told needed a current vaccination that had they told me 2 days earlier could have gotten at doctor office when there but as such would have had to make another appointment so while getting drug tested and fit tested was given vaccine and theythen come back and say that not covering that so they end up taking it out of paycheck.  Management is so so.  Poor turn around on answering questions answered.

author: Registered Nurse
comment: Staff will work with you to get the assignment and compensation you desire. Very organized and responsive. Staff is friendly and always willing to answer questions.

cons: ["No loyalty, take money away if you miss a day of work, too much overhead staff"]
tittle: They don‚Äôt have your back but always side with the company you‚Äôre currently working at if something goes wrong
author: Registered Nurse
comment: They don‚Äôt have their employees backs whenever the company you‚Äôre working at tells blatant lies, you get physically attacked by a pt and they drop you like a hot potato! They take money away from your pay if you miss a day of work even though we already don‚Äôt get paid since we have no sick day pay. They have way too many hands in the cookie jar that with every assignment your core team always changes!!

tittle: Have completed a few travel assignement and did not have a problem.
author: RN
comment: Work-life balance Work-life balance at RNnetwork is travel nursing contract negotiations  Management In general, managers at RNnetwork easy to communicate with

author: RN
comment: My recruiter looked out for me and my interests. She would call and check on me to make sure everything was doing ok. The only complaint I had was that the hospital canceled my contract with no warning and RN network did not offer any compensation for my immediate loss of work

cons: ["Changes in ancillary staff not being communicated in timely manner."]
tittle: Traveler support services are changing. I have a great relationship with my recruiter and am very happy.
author: RN Travel Nurse
comment: Travel nurses need support services that they can count on, I have been pleased with the results. My recruiter has been great fun and great at her job.

tittle: If you dont mind working alone, and like to travel - this job is for you.
author: RN
comment: Typical day at work depends on what area of facility/hospital you work in. You will learn how travel nurses are received at a facility. Management changes hands with your shift schedules. Workplace culture is great.

author: Registered Nurse
comment: RNnetwork is a travel nurse agency with great benefits and insurance. Part of my review is skewed because it‚Äôs having to evaluate where I‚Äôve worked which RNNetwork has no control, as they found me an assignment and place to work so things like making me feel inclusive, or management isn‚Äôt totally about RNnetwork but where I was assigned. RNnetwork is a great company and I thoroughly enjoyed working with them. They were always there for me when I needed them.

author: Traveling Registered Nurse
comment: Good people to work for. Recruiters are good and try to get you decent pay packages. Travel nursing as a whole is going downhill, but some companies try to make the most of it still.

author: RN
comment: I think my recruiter could have been more support at the time. I understand they need to get people into the job but during this time they should have been more support to the employee

author: RN Travel Nurse
comment: Flexible hours and excellent pay. Opportunity to meet great people. Travel to New areas and learn more about Healthcare. Great Opportunity for overtime, pet friendly housing included.

cons: ["I worked for a facility with poor conditions"]
author: REGISTERED PROFESSIONAL NURSE
comment: The company doesn‚Äôt do the work for you. You have to do all the connecting by yourself ( I. E. the license, the room and board, the drug and health screening and the actual job), as the company is not local; they just pay you. In some cases, you have to find your own work. If you happen to allow them to hook up room and transportation, make sure you have ( or they provide you with) a reliable way of getting to work; it could 30 miles away from where you live! ....üôÑüòï.

tittle: Would certainly work there again if decided to travel.
author: Registered Nurse
comment: Excellent place to work. Help was readily available when needed. My resource person was easy to get in contact with, and provided valuable insight to a potential problem.

author: RN Staff
comment: They never support their workers, it has been the worse experience in my life. I can't say anything good about this Company . Every time I had a concern, nobody gave me answers

tittle: working for RN Network was a great experience
author: RN Staff Nurse/traveler
comment: I worked with RN network as a traveler to different areas of the country. I never went to the actual office in Florida. Spoke with them on the phone often and had a recruiter that worked closely with me and was always there for me.

cons: ["couldnt always reach benefits persons or recruiter"]
tittle: staff works hard to get you hired
author: RN
comment: staff works hard to get you hired. working at different facilities on a frequent basis gives you the opportunity to learn about new medical issues - equipment, care of specialty patients, other ancillary staff, new MD interns. Must be able to navigate in any new city they send you to and find your own accomidations if necessary. Must provide some of your own equipment to perform daily duties - O2 sat probe, stethoscope, pill cutter, pill crusher, vein finder if affordable.

author: Registered Nurse
comment: Solid travel company doing the best they can to offer contracts in a variety of locations with moderate pay for market competition. Recruiters are hospitable and truly care that you are happy.

author: Registered Nurse
comment: nice company to work for. pay was great..staff members were helpful. RN network help me build my skills to become a better nurse. if I had to choose them again, I will.

author: STAFF RN
comment: Helps you get established in your field when you are new to the area. Everyone was very helpful and nice to work with during my transition of employment.

author: Staff Nurse
comment: Traveling was truly and adventure. Management worked with what you were looking for, housing was always great and assignments were fun and adventurous. Areas always had a lot of things to do when not working.

author: Registered Nurse
comment: Working with this travel agency was nice, my recruiter was great and handled everything in a professional manner. The travel agency found work in areas that I requested.

tittle: A personal and professional company with respect for the staff.
author: Registered Nurse
comment: I worked as an Acute Dialysis Nurse and the job is unpredictable as expected, many times extremely log days. It was very difficult achieving a balance with other aspects of life. The people were respectful, available and willing to work out any job related issue. The most enjoyable part of my job was the patient care and ease in working with FMS staff.

author: Registered Nurse
comment: Great people to work for, assignments were easy to set up, no problems with getting paid or renewing contracts. would recommend this travel company for traveling

author: RN
comment: All the employees are helpful & make it about the nurses. I always have the info required for my next location. Supportive all through the contract. enjoyed it.

author: RN
comment: Very productive at job placement. Recruiters treat nurses like family. Staff is easily available and returns calls promptly. Strives to find the best jobs with high pay rates

tittle: Very good place to work as a travel nurse
author: RN
comment: RN network is always on top of things; some one is always available for help; good & very up beat people at RN Network; benifits are good along with the housing

pros: ["benefits, housing, helping with recertification classes, mileage reimbursement, double time for overtime pay"]
author: Registered Nurse
comment: My recruiter is awesome, contacting me every Monday to see how I'm doing. The supervisor is great also. I love this company. The benefit package is great too. My housing has been fantastic. The credentialing department is fantastic, finding classes for recertification.

author: Registered Nurse
comment: A typical day at work was filled with cardiac issues but great teamwork and attitudes to go along with it. I learned how to become competent in a job with little training. Management and my co workers were overly helpful and were a big part of the reason that I adjusted so fast. My experience and skills with cardiac illness helped me to feel very confident, so I would have to say the hardest part was working night shift. Although I have been doing this shift for two plus years it is really beginning to take a toll on my body and I am looking to move off of this shift soon.

pros: ["there when you need them, good benefits, helpful recruiters"]
tittle: usually had positions where I wanted to travel and good benefits
author: RN
comment: I worked for RNNETWORK for approximately 10 years. I found them to be readily accessible and had numerous jobs to choose from. I liked their benefits and really never had an issue with them

author: RN Staff Nurse
comment: Able to communicate with coordinator as needed when events arrive.

pros: ["Responsive and kind Recruiter and Client Service Manager"]
tittle: Fantastic Recruiter and Client Service Manager who are very responsive.
author: RN
comment: Client Services Manager met me, walked me into the facility and introduced me to the Staff that I would be working with. Questions answered and issues dealt with quickly. Each placement is different, so it is nice when the Sites have been vetted by Covelo Group prior to placing its healthcare professionals. Not a 1099 Contract company, so taxes are taken out of pay, which is a huge plus!

tittle: It has been a pleasure and I continue to work with them
author: Registered Nurse
comment: What is the best part of working at the company? My recruiters are amazing and always work to make sure I am happy at the facility I am contracted with.  What is the most stressful part about working at the company? Haven‚Äôt had an issue yet thankfully  What is the work environment and culture like at the company? Very friendly and pro employee  What is a typical day like for you at the company? Depends where they get your contract at

pros: ["Great pay, wonderful team, fast response time"]
author: RN
comment: I have enjoyed working for this company so far. They offer competitive pay, and go out of their way to get you the best pay that you deserve. The recruitment team is great at finding a position that works with my schedule and fits my family.

pros: ["Free lunch, great pay, benefits, stellar team"]
author: Registered Nurse (RN)
comment: My experience with Covelo group has been fantastic. The job I was assigned to could not be better. They even cater us food twice a shift! The work is laid back, the expectations are clear, and my coworkers are pretty easy to get along with overall. Highly recommend.

tittle: Recruiter works hard to support YOU!
author: RN
comment: Refreshing to work for a company who is professional and supportive of their staff! My recruiter promptly returns communications, has been quick to troubleshoot questions during onboarding process and even sent my local Covelo representative to "meet and greet" me on the first day of my contract with a new client. If you are confident in your profession and contract work is something you have never tried and are interested in, I highly recommend Covelo Group, my recruiter and local rep have been amazing!

author: RN Vaccinator
comment: Working with covelo was okay to start, compensation was lower than average but you get what you sign up for. Usually flexible with scheduling depeniding on the location you arr assigned to.

tittle: Friendly staff, smooth onboarding process & good pay
author: RN
comment: I appreciate the opportunity Covelo Group offered me to work for a large reputable hospital in the bay area. The entire boarding process was very smooth, I was given very clear instructions every step along the way. I feel the staff members of Covelo respect their employees and treat them well.

author: Registered Nurse (RN)
comment: As a new grad, working for Covelo has given me the opportunity to work with reputable hospitals within my area. This has helped me build connections with other coworkers and staff members, who I may use as references for future career opportunities. My recruiter was always responsive and helpful to any questions or concerns I had. The other contractors and I initially had some concerns regarding our hours, but Covelo listened and handled the issue promptly with a reasonable solution. All my coworkers have been pleasant to work with and the work culture for my assignment is positive and supportive.

tittle: I liked working for MGA, good company
author: RN/Staff Nurse - Registry
comment: I liked working for MGA, good company, I only separated after, I found full time employment with benefits. Management was professional and fair, no problem with MGA. The work culture was fair and professional.

author: RN Staff Nurse
comment: Very little training. Recruiters were the "go to" people for Nurses, not Nursing Supervisor. No pre-employment testing to assess adequate job skills for the job. And

author: REGISTERED NURSE
comment: Registry work with contracts..You interview with families to determine if you are right fit for their home. You have to work with families schedules in order to get hours. You may have to work with multiple families.

author: Wellness Registered Nurse (RN)
comment: good if you can't find a steady job, they're super nice and youll still get experience, i worked as a flu nurse so it was a good first job out of school,

author: Registered Nurse
comment: Provided travel assignments at distant locations. Frequent cancellations.. Would leave assignments when Staff arrived.Would get paid for four hours when Companies had there employees arrive.

author: Registered Nurse
comment: Okay temp. job but doesn't really provide opportunity for advancement. This agency has more a sales atmosphere feel than one promoting healthcare. Some recruiters don't provide prompt follow-up for job opportunities.

author: Registered Nurse
comment: Provided direct patient and family care. Excelled with nursing skills for long term pediatric care. Coordinated assignments accordingly to meet daily goals and deadlines. Provided family support with home health care. Attended physical therapy treatments to maintain continuity of patient care. Provided flexible hours of operation.

tittle: Office setting with many people at work. nice staff, very calm, no rush
author: RN
comment: The work day did not involve MGA staff very much because we were sent to hospitals and were doing our job there. the staff let us work without hovering over us like other companies might

tittle: Very busy agency with many helpful employees
author: RN
comment: Very accurate and helpful. Very patient. Able to keep me busy most of the time. Handle the background paperwork for the employee which is incredibly helpful.

pros: ["Lots of free tme to play with child"]
tittle: Caring for ill children and encouraging parents
author: RN
comment: Good way to assist parent with difficulties in caring for an ill child. Low stress, high detail to the patient. Very personal in nature every shift.

author: Urgent Care Registered Nurse
comment: typical day at work: Varies with placement  What you learned: first nursing job, learned IM injection, starting IV's, performing blood draws, triage patients in an urgent care facility  Work Culture: varies depending on job placement  The hardest part of job: being flexible about job placement  The most enjoyable part of job: opportunity to explore different areas of nursing and get experience at the same time

cons: ["No benefits, no room for job advancement"]
tittle: Positive experience working with MGA Healthcare
author: RN
comment: MGA Healthcare has been a fantastic experience for me so far! The recruiters that the other nurses and I have worked with/encountered have been extremely polite, responsive, and helpful. They reply to my e-mails and phone calls quickly and are always willing to listen to and address my concerns. My recruiter has also stopped by the facility we are contracted at to check up on us personally and bring us lunch/desserts. He also works closely with the facility's management to ensure that our needs, and their needs from us, are being met adequately.  Only cons are there are no benefits (that I know of) and there isn't much room for job advancement.

author: Registered Nurse
comment: Really great to their nurses and offer great benefits but do not offer a 401k. I love working for them,=. They really look after their nurses. Sometimes even deliver lunches to you and your patient. So easy to pick up shifts

pros: ["Responsive and kind Recruiter and Client Service Manager"]
tittle: Fantastic Recruiter and Client Service Manager who are very responsive.
author: RN
comment: Client Services Manager met me, walked me into the facility and introduced me to the Staff that I would be working with. Questions answered and issues dealt with quickly. Each placement is different, so it is nice when the Sites have been vetted by Covelo Group prior to placing its healthcare professionals. Not a 1099 Contract company, so taxes are taken out of pay, which is a huge plus!

author: Registered Nurse
comment: MGA is a very good staffing agency to work for, I worked the flu shot clinic for 2014 as my very first nursing job. After the temporary position ended, I still received many calls for other positions I was qualified for. Unfortunately I had a full time job and could not further work for MGA. Definitely recommend to new nurses or nurses who may want per diem or temporary shifts.

author: RN
comment: shifts were not always available making it hard to pay the bills at times

tittle: this company was ok to work for
author: Registered Nurse
comment: This company was ok to work for but had limited facilities that is was servicing and limited number of hours that were available.

tittle: Good company with strong values but poor compensation and employee retention
author: Registered Nurse
comment: Below standard pay and no benefits, but the people are nice. There is no help for employees in personal crisis, however, which is unfortunate for a company with such great potential... Management is quick to respond to concerns, but sometimes slow in their resolution of issues. Although the hours are flexible, a nurse might sometimes finds his/herself without any work at all for weeks at a time.

author: Registered Nurse(school based)
state: I haven‚Äôt started working yet but l believe it will be a good working environment. The onboarding process has been long. I still don‚Äôt have a start date yet.

author: Registered Nurse
comment: There is no orientation. You are thrown in to the wolves They say they are there to support you but they don‚Äôt. The pay is no compatible. Director is very unprofessional and speaks to staff like a. Hild

author: Registered Nurse (RN)
comment: You get plenty of time off which is nice, and a lot of nurses like having a schedule that matches their families schedule. They don't pay well and it's almost impossible to get a raise.

tittle: Not A good company to work for
author: RN School Nurse
comment: The pay is Low compared to other companies and no benefits. Health insurance is a whole weeks pay. The responsibilities increase but no pay increases. Not enough staff. Late emails informing you of trainings or Covid protocol changes.

tittle: Great job for a new graduate
author: Registered Nurse
comment: EDU Healthcare is a very organized company, you always have someone available for you contact when needed. Flexible schedule as PRN nurse. I recommend it for a new graduate nurse or someone looking for a part time job.

author: RN
comment: The positive side is a good working schedule similar to Miami Dade Public Schools Calendar. The negative side is low salary with high responsibility level. The working conditions are not the best, at least in the school where I worked.

author: Registered Nurse
comment: The interview and hiring process were simple, quick, and easy. The supervisors communicate and respond on time, and everyone is willing to help their employees be successful.

author: RN
comment: This position is great if you have a love for children. The hours are great if you are a working parent. You get holidays, weekends, and teachers work days off. The con is pay is not great at all!

author: Rn
comment: This job has very flexible hours and you can pick when and where you want to work. Nothing is pressured. Management really makes you feel like your apart of a family. All in all a great place to work

tittle: stressful to have a boss who doesn't know and then demand that you do it wrong
author: RN Staff Nurse
comment: For me, it was the best company in terms of school base. Now they have a new RN director who doesn't know what she is talking about at all. Treat nurses badly, making them feel they don't know anything when she is the one who is lost. It does not matter that she is practically recently graduated but does not lie.

author: Registered Nurse
comment: At this company, you are your own boss. Which is nice. However, there is no support. They should let nurses meet with the families and clients to determine if it would be a good match for all parties. The termination of contract fee is harsh, because sometimes the nurse is in an impossible situation and needs to quit to save and protect his/her license.

author: RN
comment: Contract position for a school in need,nice place to work, excellent office and supporting staff.Far from home to travel for work more than an hour.Working with children in a classroom setting for educational purposes was very rewarding.Hardest part was Clinical chart review of all students for immunizations and medical issues related to beginning and ending school year.

author: Registered Nurse
comment: Just started a summer placement, so limited experience. I can say that my on boarding was quick and very efficiently completed.  I work at a summer school for special needs students, mostly teenagers. The students are the best part of my job. I truly enjoy all of my coworkers-the most dedicated and loving people in all of education.  The hardest part of the job was not having any local person to connect with prior to the first day. I just walked in as a stranger and said, "Hi, I'm the nurse." All the paperwork had been completed through EDUHealthcare. I just felt kind of anonymous at the start. But it is working out very well.

tittle: Diverse group of team members with outgoing personalities
author: Registered Nurse (RN)
comment: A typical day as a EDU Healthcare employee, includes a positive-upbeat work environment. I have enjoyed working with other clinicians employed by EDU Healthcare and students.

author: Registered Nurse
comment: Hiring process was great! Easy to contact recruiters, very helpful. Great schools to work in! Awesome EDU gear, backpack and water bottle! Hours are good.

tittle: Great company for school nursing opportunities
author: Registered Nurse
comment: This company contacted me very quickly after I showed interest online and from the start were extremely helpful. They make the hiring process as painless as possible.

author: Registered Nurse
state: I have been employed at Elderwood at Liverpool for 3 years now. One of the things about Elderwood that I love is the people I work with. It has made facing all the challenges times worth it because I know that we are in this together. I also love the fact that I have been able to learn so much. I was able to advance in my career and I know that my leadership is invested in my development and career advancement.

author: RN
comment: No team work. People have their own peers and not good to the new hires. It kills your drive and passion. You have to learn things on your own if you work here.

author: Registered Nurse
comment: Lack of quality leadership, no teamwork, high turnover, inability to retain staff, lack of basic quality care, constant resident falls, unaddressed building integrity safety issues.

author: RN Staff Nurse
comment: This is a safe, clean well organized rehab and skilled nursing facility. The staff is efficient with sufficient continuing education by management. The building itself is well maintained with on-site repair and maintenance staff. All building codes with functional alarms are in place. Residents recieve polite and respectful care by the nursing staff. The hardest part of this job is keeping up with patient activities because many residents are living an active lifestyle. The most enjoyable part of any Healthcare position is providing the best of care.

author: RN Staff Nurse
comment: Originally had a great team to work with, 4 out of the 8 hrs I was on duty (due to 12 hr shifts/split); Until we all became burned out mentally & physically due to short staffing & poor management. If co-workers weren't quitting, they were getting terminated. On a positive, they're pretty accommodative if u want to pick up hours (4,8,12,16).

author: RN
comment: Managers are engaged and present, will work the floor as needed. Great work environment. Corporate is involved and very supportive. Good team work between departments. They provide uniforms and tuition support if you want to advance your education.

author: RN
comment: Always understaffed. The ones who do show up are completely overworked until they also start calling off. If you show that you're unsatisfied in any way and then you'll be targeted by management. Management is two faced and will throw you under the bus at any time to save themselves rather than taking some responsibility for their poor management

author: RN
comment: Great place with even better co-workers! Facility is clean and supplies are always accessible! Best nursing home to work at in my opinion. Would recommend to anyone as a staff member or potential resident

tittle: Short staffed environment that lacks leadership and unity among staff
author: RN
comment: Chronic short staffing. Patient to nurse ratio is 28:1 most shifts. Leaves no time for real nursing. Horrible retention rates. Scarce training yet expected to know how to do things. Clicky place that shows favoritism and turns a blind eye to those in the click. Untrusting environment that lacks departmental boundaries. Not a lot of room for growth unless you are in the click. DON has open door policy but does not address issues unless she sees them as issues. Scabies out break that was pushed under the rug until it could not be pushed under any longer. Really sad situation for the residents and patients. Saddest part is that there are some talented and caring employees that go unnoticed and unappreciated because they are not in the click. My first day on the job I walked in ready to change the world. My last day on the job I walk out feeling used, overworked, unappreciated, held back and lacking a little less faith in my profession.

cons: ["Poor management and benefits short staffing lack of teamwork bossy incompetent managers"]
author: Registered Nurse/Charge Nurse
comment: I consider this company very poor to work for they hire per diem nurses which offers no benefits.continuity for the residents is poor as nurses are forced to work all over different units making it difficult to develop routines and get to know the residents. The unit managers are lazy sit in there offices and go to meetings they give no help or support to their team members. Some of the staff use sarcastic and foul language around other team members and residents and are not reprimanded or held accountable for there actions. Short staffing is a big problem as well as lack of professionalism and I would not recommend working for this company.

author: RN Staff Nurse
comment: I have never in my life wrote a bad review of a work environment as I am with this one. They are so disorganized, not disability friendly what so ever, Basically have to be at your beckon call all the time even when you are ill. bad work environment and everyone is under paid and over worked

tittle: Do not care about employees health or wellbeing
author: Registered nurse
comment: I worked for this company in Ticonderoga NY for three months overnight and have to say this is the most abusive company towards its workers I have ever even heard of let alone had the displeasure of working for. This company literally wrote me up for being in the hospital. You read that correctly. I was sick and in the hospital with a chronic illness I revealed to them in the interview and they hired me fully aware of the severity of my illness which is severe. I was hospitalized with a bout and they wrote me up for "missing work during your three month probationary period." I had a second bout a few weeks later and was forced to come in at threat of my job. I could not function and it was a dangerous situation for me. They then threatened me with patient abandonment as I could not perform my duties and they got no one to take my place from their ultra skeleton crew that they had to staff it. They have so little staff they cannot handle any crises or emergencies. I was subsequently fired. The second bout nearly killed me. I almost passed away for real and it took me a month to recover and they terminated me for "too many absences in the probationary period." This company literally did not care that I almost died and they contributed to it. This is not exaggerated or overblown. It is a documented fact. They force all workers to make up every single day they miss during their own free time. They schedule you without asking or coordinating it with you. The level of disregard for my health and even my life was astounding and disturbing. DO NOT WORK FOR THIS COMPANY NO MATTER WHAT BONUSES OR ANYTHING THEY OFFER YOU. YOU WILL REGRET IT AND YOUR LIFE COULD BE IN JEOPARDY AS WELL AS YOUR CAREER. The experience has driven me from the nursing profession permanently. Nursing is not worth losing my life.¬†-¬†less

author: Registered Nurse
comment: ‚óè Work-life balance found it hard to do anything on my days off  ‚óè Management Had a hard time communicating d/t emails and computers not working correctly and management not listening about email being changed and was yelled at and fired for something that I asked another nurse to finish for me because of residents not wanting to take their pills until breakfast was served then I was told i was being fired for leaving them in their rooms after asking the next nurse on to finish giving to a few people I had left wasnt allowed to tell my side when I was fired either was told she didn't want to hear it write my statement on a back of paper  ‚óè Overall I felt their were clicky people and when trying to report off felt staff wasn't listening to me as well as felt management's would expect more the more I did and day shift nurses would try to look for things I did wrong when I first started and came at me yelling about it instead of discussing or helping me when I missed a lot with training

cons: ["Healthcare is always draining no matter where you go on some days"]
author: RN Staff Nurse
comment: I'm seeing more in training here than most other locations I worked at with computer training and time with another nurse. Very impressed with training topics too. Above and beyond

author: Registered Nurse
comment: Supportive management, friendly environment & accommodating with schedules. My experience has been great working with the new management and administrator.

author: Registered Nurse
comment: Riverside is a great place to work. Management works as a team with direct care staff with the common goal of providing quality care to the residents.

author: Registered Nurse
comment: I have five years of experience in long term care nursing, primarily working night shifts. As an agency nurse, I had seen many nursing homes and can compare. Unfortunately the Elderwood overwhelms the night nurses with paperwork, which may jeopardize the patient care. The managers of the facility are good people and good nurses, but they are not ones who make all decisions. I think the upper management has too little understanding of the nursing job. Much of the paperwork we do can be computerized, so we wouldn't have to spend so much time writing manually. In addition, the workplace culture isn't the best. There's a plenty of gossiping and talking behind people's backs going on. I can remember facilities where I wouldn't sit for a minute because of the residents and patients needs. But this is the only facility where I cannot get up from the chair because of paperwork.

tittle: The head honchos are not understanding and have no sympathy
author: Registered Nurse
state: They act nice and professional at first. Then they become two faced and nasty (management of Nursing and Human resource department). They are not understanding at all regarding emergencies that occur. I lost my job due to a car accident and had to miss only two days of work per ER doctor‚Äôs order. They are not understanding whatsoever and the general orientation is a joke on a computer and they expect you to remember every detail right away. They also through out accusations. They also have not paid me on time and kept telling me my paycheck would come on a certain date and I still have not received my final paycheck. They look for any excuse to terminate someone if it effects them such as being short staffed for two days because the doctor took me out of work so I could recover. Nice at first then get mean, they know how to put on an act.

cons: ["Not enough money staff or equipment. Filthy facility old and dysfunctional equipment"]
author: RN Staff Nurse
comment: Elderwood in Hamburg rehab unit has significant staffing problems, huge turnover rates and can‚Äôt even keep agency nurse who think staffing patient ratios are unsafe . management acts like they do not care. They offer no staff motivation to pick up hours, no bonuses, no lunches . patients are receiving very basic care due to short staffing. The facility is so old , dirty , ugly. I‚Äôm ashamed to work there. Call light system fails, ac doesn't work well. Plumbing is awful. Staff are embarrassed . Staff have gone 8 hour shift with no dinner break.

author: Registered Nurse
comment: A great place to get your feet wet, but not a lot of room for potential growth. I began there as an LPN and continued working there through my RN. Once I passed my test I did not receive any further training to increase my responsibility.

author: RN
comment: I worked my way up rather quickly, which in hind sight should have raised red flags. I was thrown into a position to which I was not qualified for and was offered ZERO to little assistance. I brought up my apprehension numerous times to management however was told over and over, You'll be fine.... which I was because that is the kind of person I am, I WILL figure it out. Then the worst came... the constant "can you stay tonight?" Like EVERYDAY... Scheduling is a joke, they know weeks in advance about scheduling issues however will wait until THAT day to try and fill the spot. Management has their "click" and if they don't like you they will find a way to get rid of you (and no this did not happen to me however I did see this happen.) Elderwood is a great company with great benefits however be VERY weary of North Creek....

author: Registered Nurse
state: I have been employed at Elderwood at Liverpool for 3 years now. One of the things about Elderwood that I love is the people I work with. It has made facing all the challenges times worth it because I know that we are in this together. I also love the fact that I have been able to learn so much. I was able to advance in my career and I know that my leadership is invested in my development and career advancement.

tittle: Bully-Culture, either you were "in".. or you weren't..
author: Registered Nurse
comment: Supervisors who were paranoid and become agitated at times, who'd take sides if there was a dispute...instead of finding a solution, or at least an honest and amicable resolution. Their were a few nurses who - in my opinion - were not quite "up to snuff"... but they would find "alternative ways" to win-over management. It wouldn't have been possible using the old "grey-matter".

author: Registered Nurse (RN)
comment: I work mid-nights. 90% of the co-workers are amazing. The other 10% are sufficient. I feel this is great. The employers themselves are kind hearted individuals who care about the community they serve.

author: Registered Nurse
comment: Elderwood is a place to begin your career as a Registered Nurse. Management is helpful in teaching basic clinical skills. Staff are friendly and easy to get along with.

author: RN SUPERVISER
state: I worked for Elderwood for a short time ,would still have been there if I didnt have health issues,So let me begin I LOVED IT! My co-workers were real almost all were local however even contract staff were wonderful.DON ,superviser ,asst.admin.were very knowledgabile and fair,always whats best for patients and staff,The line staff caring and compassionate.Only one recomendation,everyone brings something to the table nuture those strengths ! Thank you Elderwood at North Creek

tittle: overall a nice facility and resident oriented
author: RN
comment: Overall a nice place to work. Staffing is better than most places. Health, dental and vision insurance is good and option for life insurance and 401K.

cons: ["Lower pay than other opportunities, poor culture among many of the aides and the more grizzled LPN's."]
author: RN Team Leader
comment: Great opportunity to learn time management, as you will be overworked and overwhelmed at the start. Unit manager was a great nurse, and a pleasant and helpful leader. Overall a good experience if you are a hard worker.

author: RN
comment: The work is hard if you care about what you do but rewarding. The administration expects quality care for those that live there that‚Äôs why I love it! The nurses and aides are also caring and hard working. Activities are also certified to help with care.

author: Registered Nurse
comment: No training, staff lack compassion and patients treated poorly. Had to leave due to conditions and inappropriate staff. Do not work here if you are a good nurse!

pros: ["The people are nice, your heart goes out to them"]
cons: ["Management, emphasis on revenue rather than results"]
author: Registered Nurse
comment: If you enjoy being micromanaged and being treated in an unprofessional way then Elderwood is the company for you! This company tracks your every move and all of their feedback is negative. No good words are ever imparted by management no matter how hard you work. Negativity is the rule. Morale is poor. The emphasis is not on providing qualtiy care. Reimbursement is the name of the game! Coordination of care between nursing and rehab is poor. Patients often get a subpar experience. If you tell the truth and give suggestions for improvement , nothing changes except that you are viewed as a malcontent. My suggestion is to avoid this company whether it be for employment or for rehab.

author: Registered Nurse/Charge Nurse
comment: I worked night shift and took care of up to 36 sub-acute rehab pts, along with 1 or 2 CNAs only, very unsafe staffing. Pts had wound vacs, PICC lines, cardiac machines and were very medical complex, I received nights of orientation. Minimal support from management.

tittle: Elderwood went downhill after new owners took over
author: RN Staff Nurse
comment: Elderwood used to be a great place to work but that's not true today. Most of management and employees are so over worked it's a drab environment. The benefits are being cut and seems anything to save a buck including quality of care is sacrificed.

tittle: I think it's a stable company with adequate and caring staff.
author: RN
comment: I did not know the area when I moved back to Buffalo. I chose the job for location and geriatric care. It has turned out to be a great choice. No place is perfect and there have been ups and downs, but the owners and management have always tried to do the right thing.

cons: ["Short staffing, never get breaks, no respect for employees"]
tittle: Do not work for this company!
author: RN Staff Nurse
comment: You do not want to work for this company! The administration and management team do not care about their employees and do not care about their residents. All this company cares about is money. Management never has the back of their employees, they often blindside employees with disciplinary actions without asking their side of a situation before deliberating and delivering punishment. Management and administration plays favorites with certain employees that they like and will always go after employees that they do not like. They are always short staffed with nurses and cna's, they receive numerous complaints about short staffing from employees and from residents family members, but they do not care. The administration and management of these facilities have no morals no values, and no respect for their employees. So, if you would like to work for a company that values their employees and respects them, then do not work for Elderwood.

tittle: Used to be a great comoany
author: Staff Nurse
comment: Elderwood was a great place to work, since the new owners took over, the place has dropped overall. Inappropriate admissions, dementia patients who n Ed more than a locked unit, doctors stopping meds that our dementia people need to keep them calm, now you come upstairs and it sounds like an insane asylum. The food they serve these people is horrendous, the dietary boss spends her days following the maintenance director around. Administrator who has no clue what he is doing, Director of Nursing who spends her days in her office, she has no idea what to do and shows favoritism, CNAs who are the bosses and nurses who just pass meds and sit at the desk.

author: RN
comment: Diverse staff- nurses, nursing assistants and respiratory therapists. Work well together. Occasionally hang out together after work.

tittle: Fun place but worry about job security
author: RN Staff Nurse
comment: Fun place to work. Benefits are not great. Pay is acceptable. Patients are well taken care of. I worry about job security in this location due to constant lay offs and then rehiring when census jumps up again. This lacks consistency in patient care and I‚Äôm attracting qualified staff to work here full-time. Overall, a good place to work as a side job but not yet consistent enough to work here permanently.

cons: ["Numbers driven, management, pay, insurance a joke with $6'500 deductible"]
author: RN
comment: Was great when it was Turning Point now run by clueless Admistration and higj turnover of all heads of departments and all staff. DON is a fill in and is a micr-manager witj ridiculous demands on nursing

author: Staff Nurse
comment: Management has no formal training in addiction medicine nor experience working in behavioral health settings. No policy and procedure manuals or addiction training are provided. Patients are not screened properly, if at all, before arriving to facility. There is no nurse to nurse reporting when coming from hospitals even if they were originally pink slipped and patients often present with complex psychological disorders and medical conditions that we aren't equipped to handle. Nurses often work alone without aides and improper assessments must be performed and documented to complete duties. Patients come for the resort atmosphere advertised and discover bait and switch tactics when it's too late to turn back. They often take it out on the nurses. DON has placed family members in key positions to form a unified front. Your prior experience and education in behavioral health will not be useful. You must be able to adapt to their way of doing things. This is a job and not a career.

author: RN Staff Nurse
comment: I'll start with the positive: Good pay (with experience). Good work hours.  Negatives: Toxic work culture. Lack of standards and protocols. Nursing leadership is extremely authoritarian. You are discouraged from asking questions. There is no standardized training. There's a lack of support from leadership. Work environment is punitive and dishonest. Wouldn't recommend. and dishonest. Wouldn't recommend. punitive.pun

tittle: Rough around the edges, but some good people
author: Registered Nurse (RN)
comment: There are some who genuinely care, and some who you are sure are only there for their salary. CEO is down to earth and his office is always open. He loves to talk to his employees and hear their feedback. Management cares...for the most part. Work is busy but easier than other jobs. Being a part of helping the patients take their first steps to recovery is rewarding. Biggest problem is the drama and negativity. You can identify quickly who perpetuates it. But if you bond with the right people, you can make it through and say you had a good day.

pros: ["The lunch program (buy into the cafeteria plan)"]
author: RN
comment: I have been working for Addiction Campuses (Swift River, Cummington, MA) since June 2017. I have not had a job that I have loved more. The way that all the staff work together to help the clients is amazing. I have not worked with a more dedicated staff, ever. People go out of their way to make sure that the clients get the most out of their stay, it's not just a paycheck here, it's so much more. I find myself learning more and more about addiction medicine the longer I work there. It is fast paced, hard work. The company is good to their employees and the nursing director works with the staff to make sure everyone gets a vacation and works hard to staff the floor. It's very rewarding work, amazing to see the clients come in and make changes before your eyes. We've expanded and need some more nurses... come on down!

author: Registered Nurse
comment: I has a travel assignment to UMC New Mexico level 1 Trauma Center, Manager was very receptive of my needs due to family medical emergency. The hardest part of this job was traveling to a different city during stressful times for the family.

author: RN
comment: I stayed with this company and my recruiter for over 5 years! I was treated beyond exceptional. If my recruiter was out of office, there was always a friendly coworker to correspond with. they feel like family. Love, Love, LOVE them !

pros: ["Casual, independent atmosphere, flexible schedule, and great managers"]
cons: ["contract, no paid days off, can make up time though, no vacation or benefits unless you buy through staffing agency, or on your own."]
tittle: Staffing agency that finds a fit for you and employers
author: RN Care Reviewer/Contract
comment: I enjoyed working contractual for Randstad, there is possibility of being hired into contract position, but the company I worked for was restructuring and downsizing, and relocating to Florida, so I was unable to become permanent, I enjoyed the work and learned much about care review/management and computer based correspondence, as all of the work is through computerized systems and knowing how to use different systems and programs, learning/understanding technology is vital for working in this field.

pros: ["They have more travel jobs. They do not take long to hire."]
cons: ["3-4 weeks without pay on a new assignment. healthcare benefits poor."]
author: Staff RN
comment: Healthcare insurance very poor.  Your 1st pay is paid after 3 or 4 weeks without pay on a new assignment.  Poor travel benefits.  They have more travel jobs.

author: RN
comment: I took a contract assignment in Las Vegas 4 blocks from the new strip. I learned a lot about medical ICU at this assignment. However, many of the nurses were foreign and were hard to understand. It was hard to get ahold of physicians at work. The hardest part of the job was withdrawal of care especially on visitors to Las Vegas. The most enjoyable parts of the job was watching your patient recovering from a traumatic experience

author: Concurrent Review RN
comment: Very Professional; if there were any concerns with my contract, they were handled in a concise and professional manner.

cons: ["Poor assessment of placement and misinformation on salary"]
author: RN
comment: My recruiter misquoted my compensation package. Then tries to get my contract released so I could be a direct hire and then the company changed the wage the computer availability and the offer. When I saw additional posting for which I qualified I was not being submitted and emailed the recruiter. Now that person has left and another recruiter submitted me for an interview which was pulled a few hours before the scheduled appointment. Four days later to find the company has no position. As a recruiter i see they must be so eager to accept and fill contracts they see not vetting their companies sufficiently.

author: Registered Nurse
comment: See earlier assessment with Hyperbaric treatment. Assisting with outpatient angiograms. Utilizing the nursing process pre, during and post procedure.

author: Registered Nurse
comment: I has a travel assignment to UMC New Mexico level 1 Trauma Center, Manager was very receptive of my needs due to family medical emergency. The hardest part of this job was traveling to a different city during stressful times for the family.

tittle: Great company, great staff, well supported, good pay
author: HCP RGN
state: Great company, great staff, well supported, Good experience from the start. They did all they could to help facilitate a quick and efficient process.

author: Registered nurse
state: I'm Swedish born trained and worked in Australia recently got back to EU. Looking for job in Sweden

author: RN
comment: I stayed with this company and my recruiter for over 5 years! I was treated beyond exceptional. If my recruiter was out of office, there was always a friendly coworker to correspond with. they feel like family. Love, Love, LOVE them !

pros: ["Casual, independent atmosphere, flexible schedule, and great managers"]
cons: ["contract, no paid days off, can make up time though, no vacation or benefits unless you buy through staffing agency, or on your own."]
tittle: Staffing agency that finds a fit for you and employers
author: RN Care Reviewer/Contract
comment: I enjoyed working contractual for Randstad, there is possibility of being hired into contract position, but the company I worked for was restructuring and downsizing, and relocating to Florida, so I was unable to become permanent, I enjoyed the work and learned much about care review/management and computer based correspondence, as all of the work is through computerized systems and knowing how to use different systems and programs, learning/understanding technology is vital for working in this field.

author: Staff RN
comment: It was a travel position. I had not problem with the company. I just could not manage working travel and plan my future. Over all the management was good.

pros: ["They have more travel jobs. They do not take long to hire."]
cons: ["3-4 weeks without pay on a new assignment. healthcare benefits poor."]
author: Staff RN
comment: Healthcare insurance very poor.  Your 1st pay is paid after 3 or 4 weeks without pay on a new assignment.  Poor travel benefits.  They have more travel jobs.

author: RN
comment: I took a contract assignment in Las Vegas 4 blocks from the new strip. I learned a lot about medical ICU at this assignment. However, many of the nurses were foreign and were hard to understand. It was hard to get ahold of physicians at work. The hardest part of the job was withdrawal of care especially on visitors to Las Vegas. The most enjoyable parts of the job was watching your patient recovering from a traumatic experience

author: Registered Nurse
comment: Great benefits and very lenient PTO. Self care is encouraged by company. They also very supportive in times of community need. The computer also gives a lot of holiday time off especially at the end of the year!

author: RN
comment: Terrible experience. Rules & work obligations are always changing. No regard or concern for employees. Given too many tasks/assessments with not enough time for completion.

pros: ["Can work remote, PTO and salary are pretty good and can qualify for bonuses."]
tittle: Centene makes a strong effort to keep employees happy.
author: Registered Nurse
state: How happy you will be really depends on your direct supervisor like most jobs. But, in general, Centene does a good job of being inclusive and communicative.

author: Registered Nurse
comment: Terrible manager, and work culture. I do not recommend this company at all! Toxic environment, and terrible culture. Managers only want to see certain ‚Äúones‚Äù advance

cons: ["Negative and toxic leadership, HR not helpful."]
author: RN
comment: Some of the Management in NYC office are completely inexperienced, downright nasty, condescending, hostile and manipulative which does not belong in any business. If leadership doesn't like you, you are set up to fail. Senior leadership needs to keep a pulse on their Management Team oversight and HR needs to change its policies regarding hostility reporting and retaliation in the workplace.  This company does not offer work from home or a combo of office/work from home, does not have a gym and has a cafeteria that offers food for 2 hours a day.

author: RN Staff Nurse
comment: Working out Fidelis as a Field nurse, it was very stressful because we had to see 2 patients for an initial assessment or three reassessments per day. The schedulers have complete control of your schedule. Sometimes the patients that you were assigned to see would not be home, so you would need call schedulers to find you another patient to replace the one that is not home for that day. And in order for you to meet your quota, replacement might be many miles away from your first patient. It was just a lot of traveling and was not very satisfying.

tittle: Unrealistic expectations set up for failure
author: Registered Nurse
comment: General computer training was provided but little to none for department specific training. Told during the interview on occasion I may need to stay to finish cases but that was a lie. You're expected to stay long hours whenever the need arose(daily), the lunch hour is BS. I took 20 scarf food down and go back to work; multiple steps to perform one task. No work flow mgr's attitude 'you should know this' and its been a few weeks. Mgr was new like me.

tittle: Little to now training for job specific duties
author: RN
comment: Unrealistic expectations with detailed tasks for job completion; no clear work flow and management sets newbies up for failure...back stabbing team members and the expectation of getting work done perfectly without a realistic learning curve; expected to stay late and they 'frown' at overtime unless you're one of the elite

tittle: Overworked and not in compliance with NYS guidelines
author: RN
comment: Training is terrible and minimal at best then you are given more work than you can do. Computer issues, software issues, making the simple things harder than it needs to be with layer after layer of time wasting moves. Not compliant with NYS guidelines so now their program is in jeopardy. Will be looking for other employment....

author: RN
comment: Once you are in certain departments they will trap you and not let you transfer to another due to high turnover and no one wanting to work in said department. Company is all about numbers and not the members. Unrealistic turnaround times and workload with pressure from management to work unpaid as they pay RNs a salary so that they do not have to pay overtime.

author: RN Reviewer
comment: Management plays favorites. Discrimination goes both ways if u know what I mean. Cliques everywhere. CEO has no idea what goes on in "the trenches". I'm on my way out, looking for other employment.

cons: ["Little respect of management toward the employees"]
author: Registered Nurse (RN)
comment: The building has mold which interfered with proper lung function. This resulted with hypersensitivity pneumonitis. The management was very condescending. Management had little respect for the employees.

cons: ["Complicated healthcare red tape, negativity in the workplace"]
tittle: Large successful corporation in health plan administration
author: RN
comment: Typical corporate atmosphere. Good salary/benefits. Was able get job satisfaction from helping members with Medicaid/Medicare, who had serious heath problems. Some micromanagement and discord amongst employees in the office. Also, some very talented, hard working people not getting recognition or career advancements. Favoritism and snubbing occurred from some of the leadership team.

author: Utilization Management Nurse Educator - RN
comment: Great culture - very millennial. Pay is decent for clinical staff but poor for non-clinical staff. Most positions are working long hard hours. They could pay better.

pros: ["occasional free food. The co-workers were great."]
author: RN
comment: Don't do it. Just don't. The expectations are unrealistic. I was evaluated by four different people every quarter and that did not include the expected productivity rating of 100% every week.

author: Registered Nurse
comment: very boring work. I feel like I spent a lot of time doing nothing that was actually worth while. I think many places are like this and it os sad. Good Luck!

author: RN
comment: Good benefits and work from home opportunities. Appreciate the opportunity to work here. Room for advancement and growth. Holidays off in certain positions.

tittle: In awe of the growth this company has undergone in 2 years.
author: RN Discharge Planner
comment: Fairly compensated flexible scheduling opportunity to participate in initiatives Executive leadership is accessible and knowledgeable of all processes.  However, there is little room for growth or promotion.

author: Compliance Coding RN
comment: Great place to work if in right department . Friendly coworkers and good hours. No holidays or weekends. Sometimes good chance for overtime which is a help

tittle: Good place to work if you have no aspirations for advancement
author: RN Desk Job
comment: Great compensation and benefits makes up for poor quality of middle management. Some departments are better to work in than others. Parent company is great, local company is so-so. Lots of internal politics make it difficult to advance unless you are friends with the "right" people.

author: Concurrent Review RN
comment: Had it not been for relocation, I would be happy to stay with this company, sad to leave. This career has given me additional skills to better complete my tasks

author: Registered Nurse
comment: Great benefits and very lenient PTO. Self care is encouraged by company. They also very supportive in times of community need. The computer also gives a lot of holiday time off especially at the end of the year!

author: CAD RN
comment: typical day - sit at your desk ALL day and make phone calls. they may tell you there are no sales involved but there is cold calling. I learned to read the reviews before applying and accepting a job. management SUCKS. not much culture to it when everyone is stuck in their cubicle doing their best to meet 100% productivity week after week. you will be critiqued on EVERYTHING, what you say and how you say it. hardest part was going in day after day knowing that your phone calls are recorded and your evaluation is based on how you are graded on those calls and whether you meet that productivity level week after week. the most enjoyable part was leaving each day. no wait, the most enjoyable part was when I quit.

author: RN Crisis Professional
comment: Call volume is prioritized over crisis needs of members. Poor support of staff in very stressful situations. Training is spotty, with focus being on failures.

cons: ["Micromanaging, threats of being fired, tracking of your locaton and computer use."]
author: Registered Nurse (RN)
comment: The culture: Very poor training at all levels Management never admits their own mistakes Great job for single people without significant others Pay is above average. If you are a field person you are tracked on your computer Health benefits above average Management writes you up for any mistake and constantly threatens to terminate you. Management talks down to you Organization uses Publicize Scorecards to pit and embarrass employees against each other. Promises of extra pay for extra work are not kept Turnover is very high. You'll get in but you'll want to get out. You have been warned if you decide to come aboard.

cons: ["3, 15 min breaks for a 10 hour shift, no lunch"]
tittle: terrible mangement, poor morale, no retention of empolyees
author: Registered Nurse
comment: Management is unprofessional and heartless. Employee turn over is amazingly fast. Poor morale. poor training to do your job. I have been here for almost 2 yrs and am the 2nd most senior person in my field

author: RN
comment: a lot ofgossipping and culture is high school- like, due to this lots of recruits and turn around in al departments still the job itself is easy enough

author: Registered Nurse
comment: This is a great company with great benefits. Everyone works well together. I have enjoyed learning about utilization review.

author: Registered Nurse
comment: There is no work/life balance...unable to take PTO when wanting to. A set schedule so you cannot miss work unless you have someone to cover for you which is impossible.  Also, scheduled breaks and don't stay one minute over or you are turned into your supervisor by 20 year old leads.  This company encourages tattle tales. I have never worked at a place where you had to watch every word that came out of your mouth.  Too many boss, there are about 1 boss for every 2-3 employees, seriously.  Job culture is awful, they want you to be a robot, it is not about customer service, although you better give good customer service, it is about call times. No bonus if you don't keep your calls under 10 minutes.

author: RN
comment: poor management, poor work/life balance, working for Fidelis 24/7, no personal life, a lot of travel. Co- workers is good.

author: RN
comment: The benefits are amazing and my bosses are great. Centenne really knows how to take care of their employees and show their appreciation to them. It s not perfect and I believe communication can be better in some aspects but no place is perfect. I really do enjoy my job and I m very grateful for the excellant benefits!

author: RN
comment: Worst company I have ever worked for!! Stay away from this greedy company that takes advantage of our Vets!!! They only see $ they don‚Äôt care about their employees at all!! Work place is hostile at best. They threaten your job if you don‚Äôt drink the kool aid!! Their practices are dangerous and often illegal!! Managers get big bonuses - workers get reprimanded for OT

author: RN Director of Nursing
comment: A great place to work! Management understands job work/life balance and respects you for what you do and who you are. Pay, benefits were great! The days were busy but you felt accomplished at days end. Office is closing otherwise I would stay.

pros: ["great core values, good programs for training and maintaining, supportive benefits."]
cons: ["As with all healthcare, there is stress but, DaVita offers additional training and programs to help manage, comparable pay but not always top end."]
tittle: Opportunities for advancement and an overall supportive place to work.
author: Registered Nurse (RN)
comment: I've worked for DaVita a long time and love my job and Davita as a company. I have been given the opportunity to learn and grow in my career with opportunities for advancement as I choose. I'm in the drivers seat. The culture of Team at DaVita is apparent in our day to day job tasks and our management is supportive. DaVita's training for each job position is clear and programed for success.

author: PD RN
comment: What is the best part of working at the company? There are some nice discounts  What is the most stressful part about working at the company? Favoritism . I was CONSTANTLY bullied. I was at a nice location for training. Once I went to my assigned unit, the nightmare began. The facility administrator was passive aggressive.  What is the work environment and culture like at the company? TOXIC!!! I felt unsupported.  What is a typical day like for you at the company? I felt undervalued every day. My requests for help were either ignored or with the administrator telling ‚ÄúThis might not be the unit for you.‚Äù

author: Registered Nurse
comment: Good training program; opportunity for growth; ongoing education; online learning; supportive management. Able to transfer to other locations. Fair and flexible.

cons: ["Thankless, long hours, unsafe patient ratios and horrible leadership"]
tittle: Corporate leadership has no concerns for field teammates.
author: Registered Nurse
comment: This has been the most thankless company I have ever worked for. The leadership team is non existent, delegates everything to anyone, makes false promises and little to no care about patient and teammate safety. You will work in unsafe ratio situations. The corporate leaders have become disconnected from DaVitas core values, its mission and only focus on private pay patients and making more profits.

author: rn
comment: often understaffed. shortage of staff makes the job very tiring and unhealthy. they should increase the salary if they want to attract more applicants.

author: RN
comment: Culture varies greatly by location and manager. Solid training and clear policies and procedures. Like most places, will try to overwork you and push you to work faster than might be safe. You will probably have to job hop to get paid what you deserve, but there is always need for more dialysis nurses. They will train you from scratch.

author: Registered Nurse
