Overall, a good place to work as a side job but not yet consistent enough to work here permanently.

cons: ["Numbers driven, management, pay, insurance a joke with $6'500 deductible"]
author: RN
comment: Was great when it was Turning Point now run by clueless Admistration and higj turnover of all heads of departments and all staff. DON is a fill in and is a micr-manager witj ridiculous demands on nursing

author: Staff Nurse
comment: Management has no formal training in addiction medicine nor experience working in behavioral health settings. No policy and procedure manuals or addiction training are provided. Patients are not screened properly, if at all, before arriving to facility. There is no nurse to nurse reporting when coming from hospitals even if they were originally pink slipped and patients often present with complex psychological disorders and medical conditions that we aren't equipped to handle. Nurses often work alone without aides and improper assessments must be performed and documented to complete duties. Patients come for the resort atmosphere advertised and discover bait and switch tactics when it's too late to turn back. They often take it out on the nurses. DON has placed family members in key positions to form a unified front. Your prior experience and education in behavioral health will not be useful. You must be able to adapt to their way of doing things. This is a job and not a career.

author: RN Staff Nurse
comment: I'll start with the positive: Good pay (with experience). Good work hours.  Negatives: Toxic work culture. Lack of standards and protocols. Nursing leadership is extremely authoritarian. You are discouraged from asking questions. There is no standardized training. There's a lack of support from leadership. Work environment is punitive and dishonest. Wouldn't recommend. and dishonest. Wouldn't recommend. punitive.pun

tittle: Rough around the edges, but some good people
author: Registered Nurse (RN)
comment: There are some who genuinely care, and some who you are sure are only there for their salary. CEO is down to earth and his office is always open. He loves to talk to his employees and hear their feedback. Management cares...for the most part. Work is busy but easier than other jobs. Being a part of helping the patients take their first steps to recovery is rewarding. Biggest problem is the drama and negativity. You can identify quickly who perpetuates it. But if you bond with the right people, you can make it through and say you had a good day.

pros: ["The lunch program (buy into the cafeteria plan)"]
author: RN
comment: I have been working for Addiction Campuses (Swift River, Cummington, MA) since June 2017. I have not had a job that I have loved more. The way that all the staff work together to help the clients is amazing. I have not worked with a more dedicated staff, ever. People go out of their way to make sure that the clients get the most out of their stay, it's not just a paycheck here, it's so much more. I find myself learning more and more about addiction medicine the longer I work there. It is fast paced, hard work. The company is good to their employees and the nursing director works with the staff to make sure everyone gets a vacation and works hard to staff the floor. It's very rewarding work, amazing to see the clients come in and make changes before your eyes. We've expanded and need some more nurses... come on down!

author: Registered Nurse
comment: I has a travel assignment to UMC New Mexico level 1 Trauma Center, Manager was very receptive of my needs due to family medical emergency. The hardest part of this job was traveling to a different city during stressful times for the family.

author: RN
comment: I stayed with this company and my recruiter for over 5 years! I was treated beyond exceptional. If my recruiter was out of office, there was always a friendly coworker to correspond with. they feel like family. Love, Love, LOVE them !

pros: ["Casual, independent atmosphere, flexible schedule, and great managers"]
cons: ["contract, no paid days off, can make up time though, no vacation or benefits unless you buy through staffing agency, or on your own."]
tittle: Staffing agency that finds a fit for you and employers
author: RN Care Reviewer/Contract
comment: I enjoyed working contractual for Randstad, there is possibility of being hired into contract position, but the company I worked for was restructuring and downsizing, and relocating to Florida, so I was unable to become permanent, I enjoyed the work and learned much about care review/management and computer based correspondence, as all of the work is through computerized systems and knowing how to use different systems and programs, learning/understanding technology is vital for working in this field.

author: Staff RN
comment: It was a travel position. I had not problem with the company. I just could not manage working travel and plan my future. Over all the management was good.

pros: ["They have more travel jobs. They do not take long to hire."]
cons: ["3-4 weeks without pay on a new assignment. healthcare benefits poor."]
author: Staff RN
comment: Healthcare insurance very poor.  Your 1st pay is paid after 3 or 4 weeks without pay on a new assignment.  Poor travel benefits.  They have more travel jobs.

author: RN
comment: I took a contract assignment in Las Vegas 4 blocks from the new strip. I learned a lot about medical ICU at this assignment. However, many of the nurses were foreign and were hard to understand. It was hard to get ahold of physicians at work. The hardest part of the job was withdrawal of care especially on visitors to Las Vegas. The most enjoyable parts of the job was watching your patient recovering from a traumatic experience

author: Concurrent Review RN
comment: Very Professional; if there were any concerns with my contract, they were handled in a concise and professional manner.

cons: ["Poor assessment of placement and misinformation on salary"]
author: RN
comment: My recruiter misquoted my compensation package. Then tries to get my contract released so I could be a direct hire and then the company changed the wage the computer availability and the offer. When I saw additional posting for which I qualified I was not being submitted and emailed the recruiter. Now that person has left and another recruiter submitted me for an interview which was pulled a few hours before the scheduled appointment. Four days later to find the company has no position. As a recruiter i see they must be so eager to accept and fill contracts they see not vetting their companies sufficiently.

author: Registered Nurse
comment: See earlier assessment with Hyperbaric treatment. Assisting with outpatient angiograms. Utilizing the nursing process pre, during and post procedure.

author: Registered Nurse
comment: I has a travel assignment to UMC New Mexico level 1 Trauma Center, Manager was very receptive of my needs due to family medical emergency. The hardest part of this job was traveling to a different city during stressful times for the family.

tittle: Great company, great staff, well supported, good pay
author: HCP RGN
state: Great company, great staff, well supported, Good experience from the start. They did all they could to help facilitate a quick and efficient process.

author: Registered nurse
state: I'm Swedish born trained and worked in Australia recently got back to EU. Looking for job in Sweden

author: RN
comment: I stayed with this company and my recruiter for over 5 years! I was treated beyond exceptional. If my recruiter was out of office, there was always a friendly coworker to correspond with. they feel like family. Love, Love, LOVE them !

pros: ["Casual, independent atmosphere, flexible schedule, and great managers"]
cons: ["contract, no paid days off, can make up time though, no vacation or benefits unless you buy through staffing agency, or on your own."]
tittle: Staffing agency that finds a fit for you and employers
author: RN Care Reviewer/Contract
comment: I enjoyed working contractual for Randstad, there is possibility of being hired into contract position, but the company I worked for was restructuring and downsizing, and relocating to Florida, so I was unable to become permanent, I enjoyed the work and learned much about care review/management and computer based correspondence, as all of the work is through computerized systems and knowing how to use different systems and programs, learning/understanding technology is vital for working in this field.

author: Staff RN
comment: It was a travel position. I had not problem with the company. I just could not manage working travel and plan my future. Over all the management was good.

pros: ["They have more travel jobs. They do not take long to hire."]
cons: ["3-4 weeks without pay on a new assignment. healthcare benefits poor."]
author: Staff RN
comment: Healthcare insurance very poor.  Your 1st pay is paid after 3 or 4 weeks without pay on a new assignment.  Poor travel benefits.  They have more travel jobs.

author: RN
comment: I took a contract assignment in Las Vegas 4 blocks from the new strip. I learned a lot about medical ICU at this assignment. However, many of the nurses were foreign and were hard to understand. It was hard to get ahold of physicians at work. The hardest part of the job was withdrawal of care especially on visitors to Las Vegas. The most enjoyable parts of the job was watching your patient recovering from a traumatic experience

author: Registered Nurse
comment: Great benefits and very lenient PTO. Self care is encouraged by company. They also very supportive in times of community need. The computer also gives a lot of holiday time off especially at the end of the year!

author: RN
comment: Terrible experience. Rules & work obligations are always changing. No regard or concern for employees. Given too many tasks/assessments with not enough time for completion.

pros: ["Can work remote, PTO and salary are pretty good and can qualify for bonuses."]
tittle: Centene makes a strong effort to keep employees happy.
author: Registered Nurse
state: How happy you will be really depends on your direct supervisor like most jobs. But, in general, Centene does a good job of being inclusive and communicative.

author: Registered Nurse
comment: Terrible manager, and work culture. I do not recommend this company at all! Toxic environment, and terrible culture. Managers only want to see certain ‚Äúones‚Äù advance

cons: ["Negative and toxic leadership, HR not helpful."]
author: RN
comment: Some of the Management in NYC office are completely inexperienced, downright nasty, condescending, hostile and manipulative which does not belong in any business. If leadership doesn't like you, you are set up to fail. Senior leadership needs to keep a pulse on their Management Team oversight and HR needs to change its policies regarding hostility reporting and retaliation in the workplace.  This company does not offer work from home or a combo of office/work from home, does not have a gym and has a cafeteria that offers food for 2 hours a day.

author: RN Staff Nurse
comment: Working out Fidelis as a Field nurse, it was very stressful because we had to see 2 patients for an initial assessment or three reassessments per day. The schedulers have complete control of your schedule. Sometimes the patients that you were assigned to see would not be home, so you would need call schedulers to find you another patient to replace the one that is not home for that day. And in order for you to meet your quota, replacement might be many miles away from your first patient. It was just a lot of traveling and was not very satisfying.

tittle: Unrealistic expectations set up for failure
author: Registered Nurse
comment: General computer training was provided but little to none for department specific training. Told during the interview on occasion I may need to stay to finish cases but that was a lie. You're expected to stay long hours whenever the need arose(daily), the lunch hour is BS. I took 20 scarf food down and go back to work; multiple steps to perform one task. No work flow mgr's attitude 'you should know this' and its been a few weeks. Mgr was new like me.

tittle: Little to now training for job specific duties
author: RN
comment: Unrealistic expectations with detailed tasks for job completion; no clear work flow and management sets newbies up for failure...back stabbing team members and the expectation of getting work done perfectly without a realistic learning curve; expected to stay late and they 'frown' at overtime unless you're one of the elite

tittle: Overworked and not in compliance with NYS guidelines
author: RN
comment: Training is terrible and minimal at best then you are given more work than you can do. Computer issues, software issues, making the simple things harder than it needs to be with layer after layer of time wasting moves. Not compliant with NYS guidelines so now their program is in jeopardy. Will be looking for other employment....

author: RN
comment: Once you are in certain departments they will trap you and not let you transfer to another due to high turnover and no one wanting to work in said department. Company is all about numbers and not the members. Unrealistic turnaround times and workload with pressure from management to work unpaid as they pay RNs a salary so that they do not have to pay overtime.

author: RN Reviewer
comment: Management plays favorites. Discrimination goes both ways if u know what I mean. Cliques everywhere. CEO has no idea what goes on in "the trenches". I'm on my way out, looking for other employment.

cons: ["Little respect of management toward the employees"]
author: Registered Nurse (RN)
comment: The building has mold which interfered with proper lung function. This resulted with hypersensitivity pneumonitis. The management was very condescending. Management had little respect for the employees.

cons: ["Complicated healthcare red tape, negativity in the workplace"]
tittle: Large successful corporation in health plan administration
author: RN
comment: Typical corporate atmosphere. Good salary/benefits. Was able get job satisfaction from helping members with Medicaid/Medicare, who had serious heath problems. Some micromanagement and discord amongst employees in the office. Also, some very talented, hard working people not getting recognition or career advancements. Favoritism and snubbing occurred from some of the leadership team.

author: Utilization Management Nurse Educator - RN
comment: Great culture - very millennial. Pay is decent for clinical staff but poor for non-clinical staff. Most positions are working long hard hours. They could pay better.

pros: ["occasional free food. The co-workers were great."]
author: RN
comment: Don't do it. Just don't. The expectations are unrealistic. I was evaluated by four different people every quarter and that did not include the expected productivity rating of 100% every week.

author: Registered Nurse
comment: very boring work. I feel like I spent a lot of time doing nothing that was actually worth while. I think many places are like this and it os sad. Good Luck!

author: RN
comment: Good benefits and work from home opportunities. Appreciate the opportunity to work here. Room for advancement and growth. Holidays off in certain positions.

tittle: In awe of the growth this company has undergone in 2 years.
author: RN Discharge Planner
comment: Fairly compensated flexible scheduling opportunity to participate in initiatives Executive leadership is accessible and knowledgeable of all processes.  However, there is little room for growth or promotion.

author: Compliance Coding RN
comment: Great place to work if in right department . Friendly coworkers and good hours. No holidays or weekends. Sometimes good chance for overtime which is a help

tittle: Good place to work if you have no aspirations for advancement
author: RN Desk Job
comment: Great compensation and benefits makes up for poor quality of middle management. Some departments are better to work in than others. Parent company is great, local company is so-so. Lots of internal politics make it difficult to advance unless you are friends with the "right" people.

author: Concurrent Review RN
comment: Had it not been for relocation, I would be happy to stay with this company, sad to leave. This career has given me additional skills to better complete my tasks

author: Registered Nurse
comment: Great benefits and very lenient PTO. Self care is encouraged by company. They also very supportive in times of community need. The computer also gives a lot of holiday time off especially at the end of the year!

author: CAD RN
comment: typical day - sit at your desk ALL day and make phone calls. they may tell you there are no sales involved but there is cold calling. I learned to read the reviews before applying and accepting a job. management SUCKS. not much culture to it when everyone is stuck in their cubicle doing their best to meet 100% productivity week after week. you will be critiqued on EVERYTHING, what you say and how you say it. hardest part was going in day after day knowing that your phone calls are recorded and your evaluation is based on how you are graded on those calls and whether you meet that productivity level week after week. the most enjoyable part was leaving each day. no wait, the most enjoyable part was when I quit.

author: RN Crisis Professional
comment: Call volume is prioritized over crisis needs of members. Poor support of staff in very stressful situations. Training is spotty, with focus being on failures.

cons: ["Micromanaging, threats of being fired, tracking of your locaton and computer use."]
author: Registered Nurse (RN)
comment: The culture: Very poor training at all levels Management never admits their own mistakes Great job for single people without significant others Pay is above average. If you are a field person you are tracked on your computer Health benefits above average Management writes you up for any mistake and constantly threatens to terminate you. Management talks down to you Organization uses Publicize Scorecards to pit and embarrass employees against each other. Promises of extra pay for extra work are not kept Turnover is very high. You'll get in but you'll want to get out. You have been warned if you decide to come aboard.

cons: ["3, 15 min breaks for a 10 hour shift, no lunch"]
tittle: terrible mangement, poor morale, no retention of empolyees
author: Registered Nurse
comment: Management is unprofessional and heartless. Employee turn over is amazingly fast. Poor morale. poor training to do your job. I have been here for almost 2 yrs and am the 2nd most senior person in my field

author: RN
comment: a lot ofgossipping and culture is high school- like, due to this lots of recruits and turn around in al departments still the job itself is easy enough

author: Registered Nurse
comment: This is a great company with great benefits. Everyone works well together. I have enjoyed learning about utilization review.

author: Registered Nurse
comment: There is no work/life balance...unable to take PTO when wanting to. A set schedule so you cannot miss work unless you have someone to cover for you which is impossible.  Also, scheduled breaks and don't stay one minute over or you are turned into your supervisor by 20 year old leads.  This company encourages tattle tales. I have never worked at a place where you had to watch every word that came out of your mouth.  Too many boss, there are about 1 boss for every 2-3 employees, seriously.  Job culture is awful, they want you to be a robot, it is not about customer service, although you better give good customer service, it is about call times. No bonus if you don't keep your calls under 10 minutes.

author: RN
comment: poor management, poor work/life balance, working for Fidelis 24/7, no personal life, a lot of travel. Co- workers is good.

author: RN
comment: The benefits are amazing and my bosses are great. Centenne really knows how to take care of their employees and show their appreciation to them. It s not perfect and I believe communication can be better in some aspects but no place is perfect. I really do enjoy my job and I m very grateful for the excellant benefits!

author: RN
comment: Worst company I have ever worked for!! Stay away from this greedy company that takes advantage of our Vets!!! They only see $ they don‚Äôt care about their employees at all!! Work place is hostile at best. They threaten your job if you don‚Äôt drink the kool aid!! Their practices are dangerous and often illegal!! Managers get big bonuses - workers get reprimanded for OT

author: RN Director of Nursing
comment: A great place to work! Management understands job work/life balance and respects you for what you do and who you are. Pay, benefits were great! The days were busy but you felt accomplished at days end. Office is closing otherwise I would stay.

pros: ["great core values, good programs for training and maintaining, supportive benefits."]
cons: ["As with all healthcare, there is stress but, DaVita offers additional training and programs to help manage, comparable pay but not always top end."]
tittle: Opportunities for advancement and an overall supportive place to work.
author: Registered Nurse (RN)
comment: I've worked for DaVita a long time and love my job and Davita as a company. I have been given the opportunity to learn and grow in my career with opportunities for advancement as I choose. I'm in the drivers seat. The culture of Team at DaVita is apparent in our day to day job tasks and our management is supportive. DaVita's training for each job position is clear and programed for success.

author: PD RN
comment: What is the best part of working at the company? There are some nice discounts  What is the most stressful part about working at the company? Favoritism . I was CONSTANTLY bullied. I was at a nice location for training. Once I went to my assigned unit, the nightmare began. The facility administrator was passive aggressive.  What is the work environment and culture like at the company? TOXIC!!! I felt unsupported.  What is a typical day like for you at the company? I felt undervalued every day. My requests for help were either ignored or with the administrator telling ‚ÄúThis might not be the unit for you.‚Äù

author: Registered Nurse
comment: Good training program; opportunity for growth; ongoing education; online learning; supportive management. Able to transfer to other locations. Fair and flexible.

cons: ["Thankless, long hours, unsafe patient ratios and horrible leadership"]
tittle: Corporate leadership has no concerns for field teammates.
author: Registered Nurse
comment: This has been the most thankless company I have ever worked for. The leadership team is non existent, delegates everything to anyone, makes false promises and little to no care about patient and teammate safety. You will work in unsafe ratio situations. The corporate leaders have become disconnected from DaVitas core values, its mission and only focus on private pay patients and making more profits.

author: rn
comment: often understaffed. shortage of staff makes the job very tiring and unhealthy. they should increase the salary if they want to attract more applicants.

author: RN
comment: Culture varies greatly by location and manager. Solid training and clear policies and procedures. Like most places, will try to overwork you and push you to work faster than might be safe. You will probably have to job hop to get paid what you deserve, but there is always need for more dialysis nurses. They will train you from scratch.

author: Registered Nurse
comment: very hard to balance family life with such a busy work schedule. You are aLways on call. you have unpredictable hours. there is no set schedule. you wont know how long you will stay.

tittle: Hard to get sufficient support and management appears to just be watching from sideline
author: Registered Nurse
comment: Expectations and reality are often not in sync. Patients appreciate and are aware of the heavy workload staff are working with. Nurse workload can vary between clinics and roles.

author: RN Staff Nurse
comment: Staff does not follow policies, care is not safe, hours for RNs too long, mid level staff is ok, region management is awful. Pay raises non existent, give new hires more money and bonuses, but ignore the loyal staff who stay through all the rough times. Love the patients, but it‚Äôs not a great place.

tittle: Two different sides of the same coin
author: Registered Nurse (RN)
comment: I worked as an acute dialysis nurse for this company. It was difficult at first, but I learned a lot. I came to love the job. I took another job within the company as a post acute nurse. The reason I decided to change was because the new job had no on call. This new position involved training in an out patient clinic. The difference between acute and out patient dialysis is very wide. In the acute setting I was a respected member of a healtcare team. In the out patient setting I became a punching bag for the dialysis techs. I followed the chain of command to voice my concerns with management, but was met with indifference. I knew this new position was not a good fit and decided to leave the company because they had no acute dialysis positions available. With that said, I believe this is a good company to work for as a nurse. However, there is a difference in which side of the company you work for. I truly loved the acute dialysis side of the business. The out patient dialyis side run by techs who practice under your license.

author: Rn
comment: Overworking and underpaid. There is No real support from management. At first, I thought that is was per unit. But this is issue statewide. I guess everyone blames this chaos on the national shortage.

tittle: Good work life balance, fast turn around
author: RN
comment: Good schedule, manageable job, but too many patients coming and going so fast barely have time to work with each one. Raises are good. Coworkers are nice.

author: RN
comment: This company only cares about making money. They are very big on infection control but want you to get the patients in and out quickly. Once you hit a certain number of patients they want you to clock out and then finish what you need to to leave.

author: RN
comment: The company as a whole is good to work for, good benefits and plenty of opportunity for OT and growth if you want it. Every clinic is different, and some are easier to work at then others.

pros: ["Company culture tries to be positive and fun."]
cons: ["Overall Company culture does not translate to the operational level. Staff overworked and underpaid."]
author: Staff Nurse
comment: While being a reputable company, the company culture has changed vastly over the years. Emphasis has become more about the bottom line rather than quality patient care. Upper management needs to spend more time providing operational support and employee satisfaction to drive good outcomes rather than spending resources on driving management. Pay is below average for the industry.

author: Rn
comment: Staffs are Overwork and underpaid, that is the reason davita cannot retain their staffs. Stressful environment. So much politics going on in the unit.

author: Registered Nurse
comment: Great team work. Good environment. Long hours. 16:1 ratio. Great be benefits. Clinics are run Monday to Saturday. Opportunities for promoting within the company. As nurses we are able to create a good relationship with our patients. DaVita promotes a safe environment for all. Patients love the attention.

author: RN
comment: This is an okay place to work, however, the management is not so great. There is a lot of favoritism and micromanaging going on her. I won‚Äôt be recommending.

author: Registered Nurse (RN)
comment: I worked as a tech for a few years and then obtained my RN license. The company has definitely gone down hill fast. Short staffed everywhere and everyone is expected to pick up. Management is filled with inexperienced individuals who don‚Äôt care about clinical staff only putting money in their pockets. Early hours and long days start to wear you down fast!

cons: ["awful hours if you don't like early mornings"]
author: RN Staff Nurse
comment: This a a great place to work, team mates help each other. The pay could be better compared to other dialysis companies. Good work life ratio. Hours can be difficult if you don't like to go to work at 3 AM. Good benefits. Communication is not the greatest.

author: Registered Nurse
comment: You receieve most Sundays and major holidays off and pay is decent for nurses. Staffing levels are extremely unsafe and management struggles to retain new staff.

pros: ["great core values, good programs for training and maintaining, supportive benefits."]
cons: ["As with all healthcare, there is stress but, DaVita offers additional training and programs to help manage, comparable pay but not always top end."]
tittle: Opportunities for advancement and an overall supportive place to work.
author: Registered Nurse (RN)
comment: I've worked for DaVita a long time and love my job and Davita as a company. I have been given the opportunity to learn and grow in my career with opportunities for advancement as I choose. I'm in the drivers seat. The culture of Team at DaVita is apparent in our day to day job tasks and our management is supportive. DaVita's training for each job position is clear and programed for success.

tittle: The most important part of my job is time management.
author: Registered Nurse
comment: We work as a team and that is what gets us through our day. Teamwork is a must! I work in a SNF presently with many different people and personalities. It can be a challenge at times but we all have the same goal and that is to provide the best care possible to our patients.

author: RN Staff Nurse
comment: New to dialysis . This job has been a good experience. The management is great. The structure behind their training program is above average the only thing i don't like is the 445 am start time.

tittle: Mismanagement, will hire ppl with no healthcare experience
author: Registered Nurse
comment: Always drama amongst the techs. Treat patients like a chair. No time to chart. Benefits are good. Long hours. Lack of communication. Will hire ppl with absolutely no healthcare experience as techs. Poor ethics.

author: RN
comment: It is great! Very flexible and family friendly. Misty is utterly amazing. She spends a ton of time making sure you are proficient and comfortable in your role. Only complaint is not enough hours.

author: Registered Nurse
comment: Depends on the clinic. If you have good co workers and a good supervisor, you will have a good time. Upper management always trying to squeeze money/value out of your time. Don‚Äôt always get your hours because it doesn‚Äôt fit into their budget.

author: Registered Nurse
comment: Local leaders treated everyone without respect. They keep numbers in the brain and never think about workload and safety. Good part is my team very supportive hardworking peoples

tittle: I would rather starve than work there again
author: RN Staff Nurse
comment: What is the best part of working at the company? Worse company ever and they kill staff  What is the most stressful part about working at the company? Everything, the early hours, rude staff, stupid chatting, foot checks  What is the work environment and culture like at the company? Horrible place to work, management out of touch  What is a typical day like for you at the company? Wake up get abused for 15 hours and go home hungry and exhausted and grouchy

cons: ["Micromanagement, low pay, poor management, no support, poor training, toxic work environment"]
author: Registered Nurse
comment: This company will hire anyone. The management does not have healthcare background, usually it‚Äôs a business background. So what we get in turn are higher ups who only care about company numbers and not their nurses. Nurses are underpaid(36.50/hr), overworked and micromanaged, creating a very toxic environment. In my experience, payroll was always wrong, missing hours and missing pay, never did see the money, asked several times and all management would say is ‚ÄúI‚Äôll follow up‚Ä¶‚Äù. They pride themselves on patient safety, that‚Äôs a lie! All they care about is meeting their numbers and making a buck. I do not recommend working here. Several staff members quit at the same time I did. There is a reason why they cannot retain their nurses and staff. Stay away from this company.

tittle: I dreaded every minute of working for DaVita. The thought of working for this company makes me want to vomit. Again, being polite.
author: Registered Nurse (Hemodialysis RN)
comment: What is the best part of working at the company? I would rather stick a hot poker in my eye than work for this company. Management is horribly poor. Staff are lazy and down right hostile.  What is the most stressful part about working at the company? Everything. DO NOT WORK FOR THIS COMPANY. PERIOD! I am being polite and trying not to use offensive language. In over 40 years of Nursing (RN) this is the WORST place I have EVER worked. STAY AWAY.  What is the work environment and culture like at the company? HOSTILE in every aspect. Unbelievable!!! I am feeling ill just thinking of when I worked there.  What is a typical day like for you at the company? Understaffed, lazy staff who are on their phones constantly. You are on your own. Loved my patients though.

tittle: High stress environment with poor work life balance
author: Chronic Hemodialysis Registered Nurse
comment: The patient to staff ratio is very high, unrealistic and unsafe. Extremely chaotic environment with poor management and very little follow through keeping promises made for improving the work environment.

tittle: Once upon a time it was the best place ever!
author: RN Staff Nurse
comment: There was a time very long ago before all of the new upper management took over that I actually enjoyed my job. Unfortunately most of the management are not clinical and have no clinical background. Their main focus is profit and keeping within a fixed budget. They do not staff accordingly and do not look at the acuity of the patients when they staff. This forces the team to feel constantly rushed and unable to finish daily tasks leaving them for the next day. There are some wonderful Facility Administrators within the company and they truly try to do what is best for the patients and the staff but upper management likes to micromanage. This whole process takes what was once a great working clinic with an awesome team and destroys it. People don‚Äôt leave this company because they dislike their actual job, they leave because of the culture that upper management has created. Taking the role of a registered nurse means doing what is best for the patients, safe patient care should be our first priority!

tittle: Efficient, positive work environment that makes you miss work on your days off.
author: RN
comment: What is the best part of working at the company? You are not alone. Team work all the way  What is the most stressful part about working at the company? You work long hour shifts. You start early and close late  What is the work environment and culture like at the company? We look out for one another. The purpose of caring for our patients is the central force that binds us together as one big family. The most important part is that our patients knows we deeply care about them.  What is a typical day like for you at the company? A typical day starts at 4:30 am, and closes between 7-8pm.

author: Registered Nurse
comment: I learned a lot working there, and some management cares about their employees. Unfortunately, they were frequently understaffed, and sometimes there was low morale. Overall, it was good experience.

author: RN
comment: Busy clinic rewarding work, early hours, fun staff, educational opportunities, promote within some travel, management listens, work autonomously, good pay

cons: ["Management is terrible, no coverage in the event of an emergency, wages are way below average, overturn on staff and managers, money oriented not patient centered, managers don‚Äôt stay, short breaks, productivity standards that are not logical, and patient centered"]
author: Registered Nurse
comment: 1 out of 5 stars for poor and unfair treatment by management, My time at Davita was fantastic until new, inexperienced management took over, management doesn‚Äôt listen to the people who are on the front line, Very demeaning!

author: RN
comment: Davita itself is a wonderful company, however this market is not the right one. Training is rushed leaving you to feel unprepared for day to day patient care and safety are always concerns. New management is toxic and has no idea how to do their actual job, and shows clear preferential treatment to some while pushing others who don't personally agree with them out. The company has an amazing inclusivity policy but it is not followed in this market. Tread lightly if you want to work for them in central Florida. There is little job security and the hours are terrible. What they tell you at the interview vs what the job really is are day and night. Look at their turnover rate first before you decide to apply. It's over 75%. That should tell you everything. Not all that glitters is gold, patient ratios don't exist, and you will feel you license is at risk at all times.

cons: ["No work life balance. Exhausting work. inflexible schedules. Poor pay for what you do."]
tittle: The wrong Facility Administrator (FA) can make your life unbearable.
author: HD RN
comment: You will be working very long hours, starting very early and leaving very late. A typical shift might begin at 4AM and end at 9PM. The job is similar to working on an assembly line. The functions do not vary and are the same day in and day out. Management varies from location to location. As an RN your manager most likely will not be an RN. Keep this in mind as this is the person who will evaluate you professionally.

author: Registered Nurse
comment: Love what I do but currently looking for another job. DaVita could be an incredible company but it seems in recent years their values have shifted from patient-based care to cost-based care. No compensation or incentive to pickup shifts or take on more tasks/responsibilities. Be careful what you say yes to. Patients and staff become like family but it's tough when you have to answer to practices you don't agree with. Also-as a nurse you aren't able to leave the facility at any given time during your shift, even in family emergencies. This is really tough when you have a family and school-aged children. If a nurse calls in sick, dozens of patients don't receive life sustaining treatment because the clinic cannot open with an RN on site. The company needs a better backup plan. There has been recent talks of this and hopefully it comes together because it could be a great place to work with some important changes.

cons: ["Unable to take time off. No real training for new staff."]
author: Registered Nurse
comment: DaVita continues to hire unqualified staff in an effort to save money and keep their clinics staffed. Most of the administrators lack any type of medical training, and management experience. The clinics have a lot of turnover and are constantly short staffed. DaVita pays the lowest wages even to their few experienced team members. The benefits are also lacking, as well as work life balance. Overall I do not recommend this company to anyone.

author: Registered Nurse (RN)
comment: Team work is amazing in acutes. As a new team member I feel totally supported but the nurses that were here before me. Communication can suck sometimes but the team work makes up for it.

cons: ["Difficult at times to work with patients on a time limit"]
author: Tell-Health RN
comment: I learned a lot with Stericycle. The work culture is wonderful and the organization of company works to assist the clients. Unfortunately they were not interested or understood how to grow the business for RN skills so a handful on RNs including myself hadnpositions eliminated.

cons: ["Everything is timed down to the minute."]
author: Post Discharge Services, Cinical RN
comment: I was in a small, specialized group and got laid off. That being said, I would work for them again in a heartbeat. Great place to work, never met a bad manager, super great people. Everyone there lifts you up and is available and wanting to make sure you do your best. They truly believe in a work/life balance and both staff and management will work to assure if there is something special going on in your life that you need time off or a shift change, if at all possible they will make it happen.

author: Registered Nurse, Bachelor's of Science in Nursing
comment: fabulous it was a very family oriented company to work for., the manager was always willing to work with the employee with any issues. training was always top notch

author: Registered Nurse
comment: Fun to work, low pay, work is kind of stressful, but work environment is relaxed. Supervisor cares about staff and encourages employees to voice concerns.

author: Registered Nurse
comment: Great work atmosphere, I‚Äôm in the community mostly. Pay could be better but I won‚Äôt complain lol. They‚Äôre really focused on meeting patients/members where they are. Nurses really have autonomy!

tittle: I spent a good 8 years here
author: Staff Nurse Icu
comment: Staff camaraderie was good. Benefits for a non union hospital was good and supervision was done by proficient nurses. Management have little recognition of staff input.Overall not the worst place to work

pros: ["Education is supported, Several opportunities for growth"]
cons: ["12 hr shifts only, which is appealing for many, but became a challenge for this working mother"]
author: Registered Nurse
comment: Maternity is a fun place to work and they now have a beautifully renovated unit I liked it so well from being a patient there that I chose to work there

author: RN
comment: They're permanently short handed. Which says something about the job, but it also means that you can pick up a lot of hours.  They seem to have people who actually provide patient care, and people who sit in offices and make sure that if anything bad ever happens, it's the fault of the people who actually provide patient care. But then, that's been my experience with all nursing. (And probably all jobs). So you should be used to it.  This is the only corrections job I've ever worked. But the impression I get is that compared to most corrections, this place is "one of the good ones".

tittle: Great environment and room for advancement within the company which is always a plus.
author: Registered Nurse
comment: Wonderful environment, excellent benefits.Atypical work day would be fast pace, but I'm able to get through it. Time management is key and friendly staff.

author: RN Staff Nurse
comment: daily interesting challenges , large volume of patients, get to use many different skills, always looked forward to the day, learned a lot from this different setting

author: Registered Nurse (RN)
comment: I wanted to try a different kind of nursing outside of a hospital. Realized it's not my kind of nursing. It wasn't a bad experience. It was very different from what I am used to.

author: Registered Nurse
comment: This place is terrible. Very unsafe. No job satisfaction besides leaving work. Management is fake. Administration is safe, but they did not care about the nurses, techs, etc.!!! Shameful.

author: Registered Nurse (RN)
comment: Great team to work with, close to home. Worked in corrections before, helped with entering this work field. Would recommend to other nurses. Wish the hourly wage would be more comparable to the hospital rate of pay.

author: RN
comment: The company has good cheer leaders, but there is little or no support for the local people. Corporate Chiefs may act when the ox is in the ditch, which makes it very stressful for the local Indians. It is also expensive considering overtime and staff turnover. There is also a lot of duplication in the paper/computer work and with the physician. But what does a lowly RN know, who was terminated while recovering from back surgery.

author: Registered Professional Nurse
comment: Opportunity to improve your skills, autonomy is a certainty. A safe environment is always provided. There are room for growth and opportunities to grow with the company,

author: Registered Nurse
comment: Nurses frequently operate outside of their license. No patient care. It is an assembly line. 1 NP and 1 Doctor to take care of 1000 patients. It is not safe, people are going to die. The DON and HSA have no idea what they are doing, the company hires the first people that apply. You call for help and they don't answer the phone. It is extremely dangerous. The sheriff said he was going to make changes, hope he gets that company out of there.

author: STAFF RN
comment: Lack of support from management. Constantly understaffed. Many employees were not qualified. The environment was filthy. Required to work mandatory overtime.

pros: ["challenging, rewarding work in a company that recognizes good employees"]
cons: ["You have to work to be recognized and do your work well, Get along with colleagues, be dependable, volunteer for extra shifts or jobs when you can."]
tittle: Want to feel great about your job?
author: Registered Nurse (RN)
comment: I have worked for Wellpath for the last three years in two sites. We work hard here and we are accountable for our work, as it should be. The people we serve are the most challenging and vulnerable citizens in our country in many ways. They deserve kind and compassionate care 24/7.  What I have noticed is that some people get hired that do not really understand what they are signing on for. They think it might be easy or that they will be able to take a lot of breaks or that they can make patients do what the staff want. That is not the model and should not be. What I have found is that if you work hard and you care about your job and the people you are being paid to provide service to you will do great at WPRS. That is all they ask. And if you have a bad supervisor all you need to do it go to HR for help. And go back to school. WP always supports that!

author: RN
comment: If you value your license steer clear of this place. They will have you working with only one nurse to care for 100s-1000s of inmates. The officers don't know that they are officers they feel the need to tell you how to do your job. Too much gossiping. Management sucks and are only concerned about themselves. They will not come in and help out when short. will not come i

tittle: Not a terrible place, but definitely not the best
author: Registered Nurse
comment: Nursing management here is a joke. Most of these people in management do not have the credentials to do so. How in the world can an LPN be in charge of an RN, BSN?? You can't perform my duties therefore how can you be in charge of anything or carry yourself as such. The pay is alright, but much better at CCA. A lot of people working here are lazy and will almost do more work to avoid doing the actual work. Management has its favorite facilities and will cater to their needs every single time over one that is struggling.

author: RN
comment: Not enough staff. Nurses working alone. No raises. No appreciation for working to cover shifts. Cannot retain employees. Difficulty in finding nurses to apply. Med aides are not professional and try and get involved in nursing duties. unit secretary has no medical education but believes she has some sort of input in nursing conversations. nurse practitioner was fired from previous job.

author: Registered Nurse
comment: Work with IM was fine bc most of them appreciate the help. Mgmt in medical is poor w/o improvement since I left. Worked up to 17 hour days w/o any appreciation.

author: RN
comment: This company is a joke. They staff poor prepared individuals as directors and managers that all lie. Less than poor communication, will not return calls, lack of professionalism, and it‚Äôs no wonder why they look on here to staff. Because nobody wants to work for this dysfunctional company that only allows the rejects to work for them. Anyone with experience and credentials definitely need not apply.

tittle: Worse work culture I've ever seen!
author: RN Staff Nurse
comment: Management never around. Supervisors are demeaning. The training is non-existent, and co-workers are not helpful. Atmosphere is strange--too much gossiping, and attitude.

cons: ["Terrible management and HR is even worse"]
author: Registered Nurse
comment: Worst company I've ever worked for. I have 20 yrs of experience as an RN. They chew you up and spit you out. VERY HIGH TURNOVER. Morale is very low. Stay away

author: RN
comment: The Grand Junction jail is very educational. Never have a day where you don‚Äôt learn something new. Love my job. Fast paced environment allows you to stay on your toes and learn along the way.

author: RN
comment: Juvenile hall RN, very poor management abusive, dangerous med cart pushed each shift. Last minute schedule changes, high turnover. Manager hiring all her friends and full of messy drama so unprofessional! Manager is a serious stress case.

author: Registered Nurse (RN)
comment: Managers were the worst, inexperienced and snotty. Very cut throat and catty atmosphere. Guards were anti nurse from the beginning. The care was sad and if you don‚Äôt mind having 700 patients by your self then go get a job, it‚Äôs easy they hire anyone. New grads with little experience or training responsible for emergency care.

author: RN
comment: They're permanently short handed. Which says something about the job, but it also means that you can pick up a lot of hours.  They seem to have people who actually provide patient care, and people who sit in offices and make sure that if anything bad ever happens, it's the fault of the people who actually provide patient care. But then, that's been my experience with all nursing. (And probably all jobs). So you should be used to it.  This is the only corrections job I've ever worked. But the impression I get is that compared to most corrections, this place is "one of the good ones".

author: Registered Nurse
comment: Good benefits Good pay Flexible schedules A lot of over time can be made Sometimes too much work to do Good work place culture. A place to grow higher good benefits Good work experience Flexible hours to work Job security

author: RN Staff Nurse
comment: Lots of drama all throughout this company. Kept things interesting but it gets old quick. Hard to trust upper management who will tell you one thing and then turn around and do something else, never keep their promises. Very disloyal to their people.

cons: ["Pay, long hours, useless computer system, NO Support from management, and professional license at risk DAILY"]
author: RN Staff Nurse
comment: Don't have time to eat lunch or dinner. Management don't know what they are doing and can't keep employees or remain fully staffed. Newly hired employees make more than the current employees with no experience or fresh out of school over employees with over 10+ years of experience. No chart notes, agency nurses come in and make suggestions they follow, but if employees suggest it, the company state the employee is complaining. Someone need to do an external investigation. Inmate's healthcare is at a high risk.

cons: ["Lack of proper equipment, staffing issues, poor management"]
author: RN Staff Nurse
comment: The worst company I‚Äôve ever worked for! Management is worthless and never offers help when staff is drowning. They would rather blame staff for mistakes than help out in order to prevent them. They create a dangerous environment.

tittle: New to corrections but so far so good
author: rn
comment: Needs organization but management supportive of new ideas. Stressful.. like any nursing job.. at times but rewarding in its own way.Pay competitive for the industry but benefits somewhat lacking(pto etc).Flexible scheduling.

tittle: Good - Staff beside you Bad - Lack of support from upper management
author: RN, BSN
comment: Staff Nurse OK - great camaraderie Site Leadership varies Upper RO nonexistent Working alongside corrections officers is good experience Unique environment

author: Registered Nurse
comment: Worst part of job is being short staffed but when all positions are filled it‚Äôs easier to handle. Company promotes autonomy which is great. With any job, reliable coworkers make it worthwhile.

author: RN
comment: Terrible environment, no support from regional management. Always promising, never delivering. They changed things on a whim without thinking how it would impact our team, this included our leaders. Please think twice.

cons: ["Mentally taxing job with very little appreciation"]
author: RN Staff Nurse
comment: Supervisors will sit at home or in their office and let line staff drown! Lack of consistency. Very little training before your thrown out on your own, sink or swim. Corporate not available to staff, do not listen to staff concerns. Supervisor makes unreasonable demands for your shift, but doesn‚Äôt know how to do the job themselves. Only day shift treated to meals and appreciation rewards, night shift completely disregarded. Very closed groups, not welcoming to new staff members.

pros: ["They attempt to win you over by catering food"]
tittle: Company does not care about employees
author: Nurse, staff
comment: If you‚Äôre a good worker, you are always asked to do more. If you ever question anything you upside of your job duties, it always falls under ‚Äúother duties as assigned‚Äù. Compensation is not fair, no retention bonuses, but will give new staff 10k sign in bonuses. You are not respected as a person, just another replaceable number.

pros: ["Employees are some of the best people you will ever meet. Team is collaborative. Work is exciting."]
cons: ["HSA has no medical experience or license, Director of nursing is new RN without management job experience."]
tittle: The team and employees are incredible
author: RN
comment: Current management is bias. Unfair treatment and high expectations are placed on a number of employees and not others. Leaders are incognizant unacquainted in their roles. Employees suffer the consequences. The people that work here are some best people you will ever meet. Wait a year to apply.

author: RN
comment: The workload is not heavy. It is a prison so drama comes with the territory. However, Wellpath does a good job at keeping a typically chaotic environment organized. Staff are helpful. Pay ranges depending on role and status.

pros: ["Always something new, development of assesment skills, learning to be self directed, awesome HSA and Charge"]
cons: ["Hostile work environment, DON will degrade you, worst schedule ever, horrible pay."]
tittle: Has a the capabilities of an amazing job.
author: Staff Nurse
comment: It takes a special kind of individual to become and remain a corrections nurse. The corrections system can and will suck away your soul if you allow it too. You must love it in and out. You have to care, be compassionate, and show empathy, and respect. All while keeping up an extremely high electric wall with rabid pitfalls on the other side. These jokers are manipulative and sly. Many always trying to get over on you even for the littlest of things. You have to learn how to see the forest through the trees and quick. The things you are subject to seeing hearing and dealing with can cause a true desensitization that can make one grow cold and mean and worry more about their opinion of a patient than what they are being paid to do. Most of the nurse have forgotten their oath. Many have forgotten that they are patients to us not inmates. Yes they can, will, and are a pain in the whole hind side. They think they are in some 5 star hotel and you work for them. But they are still patients and they still need our help, they don't need the nurses kicking them while they are down. We are nurses to advocate and uplift not look down our noses like they are savages. Many have lost their way in nursing and nothing is done.

tittle: Correctional RN at small county jail
author: RN
comment: Great supportive management. Very workable with scheduling and communicates well with employees. Twelve hour shifts with 1 RN and 1 LVN per shift so responsibility is high, especially when needed to respond to a "Man Down". Medical benefits need improving. Expensive.

pros: ["Pay, culture, management, free lunches, fun and busy job."]
tittle: Excellent work environment and awesome management
author: RN
comment: Great pay, great place to work, management is awesome and actually cares and listens to their employees. Best people to work with both custody and Wellpath staff. They finally have people that know how to lead and how to hire the right people. Highly recommend the SLO County Jail location!

tittle: Decent pay and time off if they let you use it
author: Registered Nurse
comment: You get plenty of time off but always short staffed so you are not allowed to use it. The time off is not paid out to you if you don‚Äôt use it either either use it or loose it. Forget it if you have a family emergency they don‚Äôt care you have to apply for FMLA in order to get time off. Management is awful at the three facilities at worked at.

tittle: Relatively low-stress Environment and major Autonomy
author: Registered Nurse
comment: This was my first-time working as a correctional nurse and I must say it was a surprisingly pleasant experience. The pay and 401K package is exceptional. Co-workers make your day go by faster. For the most part, the nurses work as a team and are willing to help the new nurses. They made my days go by faster. Management was strict but fair, and set clear boundaries which I appreciated. You must absolutely have excellent assessment skills, and the ability to pay attention to detail. If you are a pushover type of nurse this job may not be for you. I would recommend to other nurses interested in correctional, forensics health.

pros: ["Easy to get a job as a new nurse"]
author: Registered Nurse
comment: Poor management, they hire anybody and with no experience in corrections. Poor training I only got 3 days! At will employee and they fire you for anything. The management is always right and can yell at you or belittle you. They make up rules as they go along like mandatory overtime. I was asked to clock out for lunch, but to keep my radio turned on in case they needed me while I was eating. Understaffing is the biggest problem. If you enjoy working as the ONLY RN in the building this is the place for you. The workload is too much and the management will not help the nursing staff on the floor, but rather make you work alone or harder.

author: RN
comment: The deputies need to be more involved with the medical staff and work as more of a joint effort I did feel like I was protected and they did have my back. All staff friendly

author: RN
comment: Toxic people, toxic environment. No support from HSA or DON. Providers give substandard , poor care. If you care about your job and you put in effort ; you will be driven out.

author: RN
comment: They're permanently short handed. Which says something about the job, but it also means that you can pick up a lot of hours.  They seem to have people who actually provide patient care, and people who sit in offices and make sure that if anything bad ever happens, it's the fault of the people who actually provide patient care. But then, that's been my experience with all nursing. (And probably all jobs). So you should be used to it.  This is the only corrections job I've ever worked. But the impression I get is that compared to most corrections, this place is "one of the good ones".

tittle: Feel free to take the job if leadership support is a LOW priority and value.
author: Virtual Registered Nurse
state: So I've been in healthcare for over 20 years. Granted, I took a risk moving forward with WP in the beginning stages of a new division. Yes, my eyes were wide open. Once I was reeled in though, I felt unimportant especially when, of no fault of my own, my license activation process delayed and they forgot about me. (Avoided me?) In fact, they had "nothing for me" for about 5 weeks as a PRN RN. Although, and perhaps because, it's growing quickly, I would steer clear of the Virtual Nursing division. They've definitely a few favorites aka "pets." Training is subpar. When I needed more training, I was left behind. I was reprimanded for my communication style yet they feel free to come off rude and uncaring, in a caregiving business. Don't let the dollar signs and fancy equipment fool you. Cold, rude, impatient people. Especially the D.O.N. I hope and pray those paying for their services become aware of their money hungry "care." Glad I'm outta there!

tittle: Go If you‚Äôre Desperate and like Micro Management
author: Registered Nurse (RN)
comment: I no longer work here for a reason. This company will bend over backwards to recruit new hires and fast track you into the hiring process. They will promise you everything you could possibly think of benefits and compensation wise, but for a steep price of a toxic, micromanaged workplace. You will be watched heavily your first few days on the job. I couldn‚Äôt even use the restroom when I wanted. I‚Äôm glad to be out of there!!

pros: ["Awesome coworkers, and able to assist an overlooked patient population"]
tittle: Toxic leadership from the regional level down
author: Correctional Registered Nurse (RN)
comment: If you stand up for yourself and speak your mind, they‚Äôll railroad you with write ups for termination. If you have medical documentation stating you can only work as tolerated. They hold it against you. Safety concerns are ignored. Negligent care is blatant and ignored ‚Äú they show up on time‚Äù Staff blamed for not getting support if you don‚Äôt pick up extra shifts. It goes on and on. High turnover at the site leadership level Pushing good solid staff away.

author: Registered Nurse (RN)
comment: Workload is manageable and pts are considerate. Lots of autonomy Detention staff is polite and welcoming Money is good. Just got benefits and they seem reasonable.

author: RN Corrections Sick Call
comment: What is the best part of working at the company? The manager and staff overall best experience  What is the most stressful part about working at the company? The corporate Hr Sytems and unfairness of not listening to the truth at management level they eat their own.  What is the work environment and culture like at the company? Not aware of the truth and allowing subordinates to gang up on managers. Especially at the medically practices. Running off sharp managers.  What is a typical day like for you at the company? Was hectic at medical practice. The staff and people are frinds and fight to get overtime when not needed.

author: Registered Nurse
comment: I do not recommended. Extremely unhealthy work environment. Obvious favoritism. Leadership is known to gossip and retaliate. Be cautious if choosing to work at Tulare Co.

author: Registered Nurse
comment: Instead of doing everything to retain staff. They brought in Agency Nurses and they eventually left as well because of patient to staff ratios and low pay. Now WELLPATH has there own nursing agency that travels. In addition to regular nursing staff. More money in their pockets

author: Registered nurse
comment: I found wellpath itself to be a decent company to work for; however, the facility that I was working in was very "clicky" and did not have good management AT ALL. The RN's appointed to both supervisory positions at the facility (the HSA and DON) were both very unprofessional, lacked overall nursing experience, did not follow well path protocols, and clearly showed favoritism toward some staff. My personal opinion, wellpath should provide more oversight at their facilities to ensure that the upper management positions are on PAR. As far as salary, benefits, work perks, etc., I thought that was average.

author: Registered Nurse (RN)
comment: Management is only worried about themselves. They will leave you with tons of work while they are hiding in their office or not even come into work. You could be short staffed and they will not come in to help, they won't help even if they are there.
